abbey

/ˈæb.i//ˈæb.i/
noun [C]
大修道院;大寺院;大教堂[英]^(a building where monks or nuns live or used to live. Some abbeys are now used as churches)
  • ((Westminster Abbey::
    威斯敏斯特大教堂))

abduct

/æbˈdʌkt//æbˈdʌkt/
verb [T]
绑架;劫持;诱拐[英]^(to force someone to go somewhere with you, often using threats or violence)
  • ((The company director was abducted from his car by terrorists.::
    公司董事被恐怖分子从自己的车里劫走了。))
MEDICAL
使（肢体等）外展[英]^(to move a part of the body away from the central part of the body or away from another body part)
  • ((Listen for a clicking sound as the child's hips are abducted.::
    听，这个孩子的髋部外展打开时就会发出咔嗒一声。))

abort

/əˈbɔːt//əˈbɔːrt/
verb
[I or T]
中止;使夭折;使中途失败[英]^(to cause something to stop or fail before it begins or before it is complete)
  • The mission had to be aborted at the last minute.
  • If something goes wrong during the launch sequence the system will automatically abort.
[I or T]
（通常指通过手术）堕胎，人工流产[英]^(to stop the development of a baby that has not been born, usually by having a medical operation)
  • He declared that women have a right to abort a nonviable fetus.
  • The decision to abort may be based on many factors.
[I]
流产，小产（miscarry 的另一种说法）[英]^(to have a miscarriage (= an early, unintentional end to a pregnancy))
  • The bacterial infection can cause animals to abort.

accord

/əˈkɔːd//əˈkɔːrd/
noun [C or U]
（正式的）协议;条约;一致;符合[英]^((a formal) agreement)
  • ((On 31 May the two leaders signed a peace accord.::
    5月31日两位领导人签署了一项和平协议。))
  • ((The project is completely in accord with government policy.::
    该项目完全符合政府政策。))
  • A vague murmur of accord rose from around the table.
  • ((Before 1987, the accord between the Labour government and the unions was a simple affair.::
    1987年以前，工党政府和工会之间很容易达成一致。))
verb [T]
（通常指恭敬地）给予（特殊待遇）;授予[英]^(to treat someone specially, usually by showing respect)
  • ((The massed crowds of supporters accorded him a hero's welcome.::
    蜂拥云集的支持者们给予他英雄般的欢迎。))
  • ((Certainly in our society teachers don't enjoy the respect that is accorded to doctors and lawyers.::
    的确，在我们这个社会中，老师没有得到像医生和律师所受到的那种尊敬。))

of your own accord

/əˈkɔːd//əˈkɔːrd/
noun [C or U]
C2
她自愿来的，没有人让她来。[英]^(If you do something of your own accord, you do it without being asked to do it)
  • ((She came of her own accord. No one asked her to come.::
    她自愿来的，没有人让她来。))

with one accord

/əˈkɔːd//əˈkɔːrd/
noun [C or U]
所有代表一致退出会议。[英]^(If people do something with one accord, they do it together and in complete agreement)
  • ((With one accord, the delegates walked out of the conference.::
    所有代表一致退出会议。))

accredit

/əˈkred.ɪt//əˈkred.ɪt/
verb [T]
鉴定…为合格;认可;认为…属实;授权[英]^(to officially recognize, accept, or approve of someone or something)
  • ((The agency was not accredited by the Philippine Consulate to offer contracts to Filipinos abroad.::
    该代理处没有得到菲律宾领事馆的批准，无权向国外的菲律宾人提供承包合同。))

accrue

/əˈkruː//əˈkruː/
verb [I]
积累；（逐渐）增加，增多[英]^(to increase in number or amount over a period of time)
  • ((Interest will accrue on the account at a rate of seven percent.::
    账户上的存款将会以7%的利率生息。))
  • ((Little benefit will accrue to the city (= it will receive little benefit) from the new transport links.::
    新的道路修建计划几乎不会给该城市带来什么利益。))

acquit

/əˈkwɪt//əˈkwɪt/
verb [T often passive]
-tt-
宣判…无罪[英]^(to decide officially in a law court that someone is not guilty of a particular crime)
  • ((She was acquitted of all the charges against her.::
    她被宣判无罪，所有对其指控皆不成立。))
  • ((Five months ago he was acquitted on a shoplifting charge.::
    5个月前，法庭宣判对他在商店盗窃货物的指控不成立。))

acquit yourself

/əˈkwɪt//əˈkwɪt/
verb
-tt-
（在困难的情况下）表现出色[英]^(to do better than expected in a difficult situation)
  • ((I thought that he acquitted himself admirably in today's meeting.::
    我认为他在今天会议上的表现非常不错。))
  • If Holmes acquits herself well in today's race, she may earn a place in the national team.
  • The three starting forwards acquitted themselves quite well in last night's game.

adjoin

/əˈdʒɔɪn//əˈdʒɔɪn/
verb [I or T]
紧挨；邻接；贴近；毗连[英]^(to be very near, next to, or touching)
  • ((The stables adjoin the west wing of the house.::
    马厩紧挨着房子的西厢。))
  • ((It's at this point that these three neighbourhoods adjoin.::
    这儿正是这三个街区的交界点。))

administrator

/ədˈmɪn.ɪ.streɪ.tər//ədˈmɪn.ə.streɪ.t̬ɚ/
noun [C]
C1
管理人员，行政人员[英]^(someone whose job is to control the operation of a business, organization, or plan)
  • ((From 1969 to 1971, he was administrator of the Illinois state drug abuse program.::
    从1969年到1971年间，他主持伊利诺伊州禁毒计划。))
  • ((She works as a school administrator.::
    她是学校的一名行政人员。))

admiral

/ˈæd.mər.əl//ˈæd.mər.əl/
noun [C]
(also Admiral)
海军将军;海军上将;舰队司令[英]^(an officer of very high rank in the navy)
  • ((Admiral Nelson/Horatio Nelson::
    海军上将纳尔逊/霍雷肖·纳尔逊))
  • ((Yes, Admiral.::
    “是的，将军。”))

adorn

/əˈdɔːn//əˈdɔːrn/
verb [T]
装扮;装饰[英]^(to add something decorative to a person or thing)
  • ((The bride's hair was adorned with white flowers.::
    新娘的头上戴着白色的花朵。))

adversary

/ˈæd.və.sər.i//ˈæd.vɚ.ser.i/
noun [C]
对手，敌手[英]^(an enemy)
  • ((He saw her as his main adversary within the company.::
    在他眼中，她是他在公司中的头号对手。))

aerobics

/eəˈrəʊ.bɪks//erˈoʊ.bɪks/
noun [U]
有氧健身法;有氧运动[英]^(energetic physical exercises, often performed with a group of people to music, that make the heart, lungs, and muscles stronger and increase the amount of oxygen in the blood)
  • ((She does aerobics.::
    她做有氧健身操。))
  • ((I go to aerobics (= to a class where we are taught such exercises) once a week.::
    我每周去一次有氧健身操训练班。))
  • ((an aerobics instructor/teacher::
    有氧健身操教练／教师))

aerospace

/ˈeə.rə.speɪs//ˈer.oʊ.speɪs/
adjective [before noun]
航空航天工业的;航空航天器制造的[英]^(producing or operating aircraft or spacecraft)
  • ((the aerospace industry::
    航空航天工业))
  • ((an aerospace company::
    航空航天技术公司))

affinity

/əˈfɪn.ə.ti//əˈfɪn.ə.t̬i/
noun
[S]
（尤指因为有相同的特征而引起的）情投意合，喜爱，吸引[英]^(a liking or sympathy for someone or something, especially because of shared characteristics)
  • ((She seems to have a natural affinity for/with water.::
    她好像天生就喜欢水。))
[C or U]
类同；雷同[英]^(a close similarity between two things)
  • ((There are several close affinities between the two paintings.::
    这两幅画有多处非常相似的地方。))

afflict

/əˈflɪkt//əˈflɪkt/
verb [T]
使痛苦;使苦恼;折磨[英]^(If a problem or illness afflicts a person or thing, they suffer from it.)
  • ((It is an illness that afflicts women more than men.::
    患这种疾病的女性多于男性。))
  • ((a country afflicted by civil war::
    饱受内战蹂躏的国家))

aide

/eɪd//eɪd/
noun [C]
（政府或军队高官等的）助理，助手[英]^(a person whose job is to help someone important, such as a member of a government or a military officer of high rank)
  • ((a senior government aide::
    政府高级助理))
  • ((an aide to the prime minister::
    首相助理))

ail

/eɪl//eɪl/
verb
[T]
困扰，使苦恼；使处境困难[英]^(to cause difficulty and problems for someone or something)
  • ((The government seems to have no understanding of what ails the country.::
    政府好像不了解国家问题的症结所在。))
[I or T]
（使）生病;（使）不适[英]^(to be ill, or to cause to be ill)
  • ((She had been ailing for years before she died.::
    她去世前几年就一直病魔缠身。))

airway

/ˈeə.weɪ//ˈer.weɪ/
noun [C]
ANATOMY
（肺的）气道，气管[英]^(the passage through the mouth and throat that carries air to the lungs)
飞行航线[英]^(a route flown by aircraft)
  • ((It was claimed the fighter jet's interception took place inside an international airway.::
    据称，这架战斗机是在国际航线内受到拦截的。))

akin

/əˈkɪn//əˈkɪn/
adjective [after verb]
相似的，类似的[英]^(having some of the same qualities)
  • ((They speak a language akin to French.::
    他们说的是一种类似法语的语言。))

AL

（美国）亚拉巴马州（写地址时Alabama的缩写）[英]^(written abbreivation for the US state of Alabama: used in addresses)

-al

/ -əl// -əl/
suffix
（用作形容词后缀）…的，与…有关的；（用作名词后缀）…的动作[英]^(used to add the meaning "connected with" to adjectives, or "the action of" to nouns)
  • ((medical (= connected with medicine)::
    医学的（与医学相关的）))
  • ((approval (= the act of approving)::
    赞成（同意的行为）))

alas

/əˈlæs//əˈlæs/
exclamation, adverb
（表示悲伤或遗憾）哎呀，唉[英]^(an expression of sadness or disappointment, especially when there is no hope that a situation will change)
  • "Alas!" cried the man.
  • ((I love football but, alas, I have no talent as a player.::
    我喜欢足球。唉，可惜我没有足球运动员的天分。))
  • (("Will you be able to come tomorrow?" "Alas, no."::
    “你明天能来吗？”“唉，不行。”))

alas and alack

/əˈlæs//əˈlæs/
exclamation, adverb
(also alack and alas)
（表示悲痛）呜呼，啊呀[英]^(an expression of great sadness or disappointment)
  • Alas and alack, he will not help me.
  • Alack and alas, the food was spoiled.
  • Alas and alack, nobody at that time had the job of fact-checking the statements of state officials.
  • He tried to behave, but alas and lack, he ended up back in prison.
  • Alack and alas, the restaurant owner turned down my request.

ale

/eɪl//eɪl/
noun [C or U]
麦芽啤酒，艾尔啤酒[英]^(any of various types of beer, usually one that is dark and bitter)
  • ((brown ale::
    棕色麦芽啤酒))

algae

/ˈæl.ɡiː//ˈæl.dʒiː/
noun [plural]
水藻;藻类[英]^(very simple, usually small plants that grow in or near water and do not have ordinary leaves or roots)

allergy

/ˈæl.ə.dʒi//ˈæl.ɚ.dʒi/
noun [C]
变应性;过敏反应;过敏性[英]^(a condition that makes a person become sick or develop skin or breathing problems because they have eaten certain foods or been near certain substances)
  • ((an allergy to wheat::
    对小麦过敏))
  • ((a wheat allergy::
    小麦过敏))

allot

/əˈlɒt//əˈlɑːt/
verb [T]
-tt-
（尤指将现有的东西）分配;分派[英]^(to give something, especially a share of something available, for a particular purpose)
  • ((They allotted everyone a separate desk.::
    他们给每个人都配备了个人专用的办公桌。))
  • ((They allotted a separate desk to everyone.::
    他们给每一个人都单独配发了桌子。))
  • ((The ministry of culture will be allotted about 15% less this year.::
    今年文化部得到的拨款将减少10%。))
  • ((Three hours have been allotted to/for this task.::
    这项任务限定在3小时内完成。))
  • ((The museum is planning to increase the amount of space allotted to modern art.::
    博物馆正计划增加现代艺术展区的面积。))

almond

/ˈɑː.mənd//ˈɑːl.mənd/
noun [C]
杏仁;扁桃树[英]^(an edible oval nut with a hard shell, or the tree that it grows on)
  • ((ground/toasted almonds::
    杏仁粉／烤杏仁))

alpha

/ˈæl.fə//ˈæl.fə/
noun [C or U]
(symbol A, α)
LANGUAGE • MATHEMATICS • SCIENCE
（希腊语字母表的第一个字母）[英]^(the first letter of the Greek alphabet)
adjective [before noun]
COMPUTING
初期的（用来描述在研发初阶的软件）[英]^(Alpha software is at the first stage of development.)
  • ((an alpha version of the program::
    该程序研发初期版本))
主导型人格|阿尔法人格[英]^(used to describe someone who is strong or powerful, and who likes to be in charge of others)
  • ((She demonstrated a knack for managing the difficult alpha personalities on her team.::
    对于管理团队中那些难以相处的阿尔法性格的人，她特别有一套。))

the Alps

/ælps//ælps/
noun [plural]
阿尔卑斯山脉（欧洲的一大型山脉，东起奥地利、斯洛文尼亚，穿过意大利、瑞士、德国和列支敦士登，一直延伸至西部的法国）[英]^(a large mountain range in Europe, stretching from Austria and Slovenia in the east, through Italy, Switzerland, Germany, and Liechtenstein, to France in the west)

alright

/ɔːlˈraɪt//ɑːlˈraɪt/
adjective, adverb, exclamation
（all right的非标准拼写）[英]^(non-standard form of all right)

altar

/ˈɔːl.tər/ˈɒl.tər//ˈɑːl.tɚ/
noun [C]
圣坛，祭坛[英]^(a structure with a flat top, often shaped like a table, that is used in some religious ceremonies, for example as a place to put important religious objects)
  • The ancient Egyptians erected altars to Isis.
  • The chapel contains a splendid early Baroque altar.

amber

/ˈæm.bər//ˈæm.bɚ/
noun [U]
琥珀[英]^(a hard, transparent, yellowish-brown substance that was formed in ancient times from resin (= a substance produced by trees) and is used in jewellery)
  • ((He has a collection of prehistoric insects preserved in amber.::
    他收集了很多保存在琥珀中的史前昆虫化石。))
  • Greek philosophers discovered that when amber is rubbed against cloth, lightweight objects will stick to it.
UK
(US usually yellow)
（交通信号）黄灯[英]^(the yellowish-orange traffic light that shows between the green and the red to warn drivers that the lights are about to change)
  • ((The lights turned to amber.::
    交通信号变成了黄灯。))

ambiguity

/ˌæm.bɪˈɡjuː.ə.ti//ˌæm.bɪˈɡjuː.ə.t̬i/
noun [C or U]
C2
模棱两可，意义含糊不清[英]^((an example of) the fact of something having more than one possible meaning and therefore possibly causing confusion)
  • ((We wish to remove any ambiguity concerning our demands.::
    对于我们的要求，我们不希望有任何含糊其词的地方。))
  • ((There are some ambiguities in the legislation.::
    该法规中有一些含混不清的地方。))

ambivalent

/æmˈbɪv.ə.lənt//æmˈbɪv.ə.lənt/
adjective
（心情）矛盾的；模棱两可的，含糊不定的[英]^(having two opposing feelings at the same time, or being uncertain about how you feel)
  • ((I felt very ambivalent about leaving home.::
    要离开家了，我心里喜忧参半。))
  • ((He has fairly ambivalent feelings towards his father.::
    他对父亲的感情很矛盾。))
  • ((an ambivalent attitude to exercise::
    既想锻炼又怕吃苦的态度))

ambush

/ˈæm.bʊʃ//ˈæm.bʊʃ/
verb [T]
伏击，埋伏突袭[英]^(to suddenly attack someone after hiding and waiting for them)
  • ((Five soldiers died after their bus was ambushed on a country road.::
    公车在一条乡村道路上遭到伏击，车上5名士兵身亡。))
  • ((He was ambushed by gunmen on his way to work.::
    他在上班的路上遭到了持枪歹徒的伏击。))
noun [C or U]
伏击，埋伏突袭[英]^(an occasion when a person or group of people are ambushed)
  • ((Several passers-by were killed in the ambush.::
    这次伏击行动造成数名路人死亡。))
  • ((Fear of ambush prevents the police from going to high-risk areas.::
    由于害怕遭到伏击，警察不敢去高风险地区巡逻。))

lie/wait in ambush

/ˈæm.bʊʃ//ˈæm.bʊʃ/
noun [C or U]
to hide and wait for someone in order to attack them
  • The soldiers lay in ambush, their guns loaded.

amenity

/əˈmiː.nə.ti//əˈmen.ə.t̬i/
noun [C usually plural]
生活福利设施，便利设施；娱乐消遣设施[英]^(something, such as a swimming pool or shopping centre, that is intended to make life more pleasant or comfortable for the people in a town, hotel, or other place)
  • ((The council has some spare cash, which it proposes to spend on public amenities.::
    政务委员会有一些余款，计划用来增添一些公共便利设施。))

basic amenities

/əˈmiː.nə.ti//əˈmen.ə.t̬i/
noun [C usually plural]
这座已有200年历史的监狱拥挤不堪、警力不足，而且缺乏基本的生活设施。[英]^(things considered to be necessary to live comfortably, such as hot water)
  • ((The 200-year-old jail is overcrowded, understaffed, and lacking in basic amenities.::
    这座已有200年历史的监狱拥挤不堪、警力不足，而且缺乏基本的生活设施。))

ammunition

/ˌæm.jəˈnɪʃ.ən//ˌæm.jəˈnɪʃ.ən/
noun [U]
(informal ammo, uk Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /ˈæm.əʊ/ us Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /-oʊ/)
弹药，军火[英]^(objects that can be shot from a weapon, such as bullets or bombs)
  • ((a good supply of ammunition::
    充足的弹药供应))
  • ((a shortage of ammunition::
    弹药短缺))
（指可用来支持自己论点的）信息，事实[英]^(facts that can be used to support an argument)
  • ((His bad behaviour provided plenty of ammunition for his opponents.::
    他的不良行为给对手提供了足够的把柄。))

amnesty

/ˈæm.nə.sti//ˈæm.nə.sti/
noun
[C or U]
（对政治犯的）赦免，大赦[英]^(a decision by a government that allows political prisoners to go free)
  • ((Most political prisoners were freed under the terms of the amnesty.::
    大多数政治犯按照大赦的条款获得了自由。))
[C usually singular]
赦免期[英]^(a fixed period of time during which people are not punished for committing a particular crime)
  • ((People who hand in illegal weapons will not be prosecuted during the amnesty.::
    在赦免期内交出非法枪支的人将不会受到起诉。))
  • ((The government refused to declare an amnesty for people who had not paid the disputed tax.::
    对于那些未缴纳有争议的税款者，政府拒绝给予宽限。))

analogous

/əˈnæl.ə.ɡəs//əˈnæl.ə.ɡəs/
adjective
C2
相似的;类似的;可比拟的[英]^(having similar features to another thing and therefore able to be compared with it)
  • The experience of a mystic trance is in a sense analogous to sleep or drunkenness.
  • ((The emergency vehicle for the International Space Station is analogous to a lifeboat.::
    国际空间站的应急车辆类似于救生艇。))

anarchy

/ˈæn.ə.ki//ˈæn.ɚ.ki/
noun [U]
（尤指政府消亡或垮台而引起的）无政府状态，混乱状态[英]^(a situation in which there is no organization and control, especially in society, because there is no effective government)
  • ((What we are witnessing is the country's slow slide into anarchy.::
    我们现在亲眼目睹着该国慢慢陷入无政府状态。))
  • ((The country has been in a state of anarchy since the inconclusive election.::
    自那次了无结果的大选以来，该国一直处于混乱状态。))
  • ((If the pay deal isn't settled amicably there'll be anarchy in the factories.::
    如果工资问题不能友好地解决，这些工厂将会一片混乱。))

anatomy

/əˈnæt.ə.mi//əˈnæt̬.ə.mi/
noun
[U]
解剖学[英]^(the scientific study of the body and how its parts are arranged)
  • ((An understanding of human anatomy is important to a dancer.::
    对于一个舞蹈演员来说，通晓一些人体解剖学知识非常重要。))
  • ((He later became professor of anatomy at Kiel.::
    后来他成为基尔大学的解剖学教授。))
[C or U]
解剖构造;（动植物）结构[英]^(the structure of an animal or plant)
  • ((the female anatomy::
    女性人体解剖构造))
  • ((the anatomy of a leaf::
    叶子的结构))
[C]
身体[英]^(a person's body)
  • ((On which part of her anatomy is she tattooed?::
    她的纹身刺在什么部位？))
[C]
剖析，分析；细察[英]^(a detailed examination of a subject)
  • ((The whole play reads like an anatomy of evil.::
    整个剧本读起来就如同是一份对邪恶的剖析报告。))

angler

/ˈæŋ.ɡlər//ˈæŋ.ɡlɚ/
noun [C]
垂钓者[英]^(a person whose hobby is trying to catch fish with a rod and line)

animate

adjective
/ˈæn.ɪ.mət//ˈæn.ə.mət/
有生命的，活的[英]^(having life)
  • ((animate beings::
    生物))
verb [T]
/ˈæn.ɪ.meɪt//ˈæn.ə.meɪt/
使生气勃勃；使有活力[英]^(to make someone seem more happy or active)
  • ((A sparkle in his eyes animated his face whenever he smiled.::
    他一笑起来，眼睛就亮晶晶的，一时脸上也增添了生气。))

annex

verb [T]
/ænˈeks//ænˈeks/
（通常指用武力或擅自）吞并;兼并;强占[英]^(to take possession of an area of land or a country, usually by force or without permission)
  • ((The UK annexed this small island west of Scotland in 1955.::
    英国于1955年将这个位于苏格兰以西的小岛并入其领土。))
noun [C]
/ˈæn.ɪks//ˈæn.ɪks/
（annexe的美式拼写）[英]^(US spelling of annexe)

anomaly

/əˈnɒm.ə.li//əˈnɑː.mə.li/
noun [C or U]
异常的人（或事物）；不规则；（同一种类中的）畸形[英]^(a person or thing that is different from what is usual, or not in agreement with something else and therefore not satisfactory)
  • ((Statistical anomalies can make it difficult to compare economic data from one year to the next.::
    统计上的不规范会使年与年之间的经济数据难以互相比较。))
  • ((The anomaly of the social security system is that you sometimes have more money without a job.::
    社会保障制度下的反常现象是，失业有时反而拿钱更多。))

anthropology

/ˌæn.θrəˈpɒl.ə.dʒi//ˌæn.θrəˈpɑː.lə.dʒi/
noun [U]
人类学[英]^(the study of the human race, its culture and society, and its physical development)

antibiotic

/ˌæn.ti.baɪˈɒt.ɪk//ˌæn.t̬i.baɪˈɑː.t̬ɪk/
noun [C]
C2
抗生素，抗菌素[英]^(a medicine or chemical that can destroy harmful bacteria in the body or limit their growth)
  • ((I'm taking antibiotics for a throat infection.::
    因为嗓子发炎我正服用抗生素。))
  • ((a one-month course of antibiotics::
    一个月疗程的抗生素))
  • ((Some types of antibiotic are used to promote growth in farm animals.::
    某些种类的抗生素被用于促进牲畜的生长。))
  • ((He's on antibiotics for an ear infection.::
    他耳朵发炎，正服用抗生素。))

antibody

/ˈæn.tiˌbɒd.i//ˈæn.t̬iˌbɑː.di/
noun [C]
MEDICAL
抗体[英]^(a protein produced in the blood that fights diseases by attacking and killing harmful bacteria, viruses, etc.)
  • ((Antibodies found in breast milk protect newborn babies against infection.::
    母乳中含有的抗体可保护新生婴儿免受感染。))

antiquity

/ænˈtɪk.wə.ti//ænˈtɪk.wə.t̬i/
noun
[U]
（尤指六世纪以前的）古代[英]^(the distant past (= a long time ago), especially before the sixth century)
  • ((Cannabis has been used for medicinal purposes since antiquity.::
    自古以来，大麻就一直用于治病。))
  • ((Before creating this sculpture, she studied all the masterpieces of classical antiquity.::
    在创作这件雕塑之前，她研究了所有古典时期的雕塑杰作。))
[C]
古物;古董;古迹[英]^(an object that was created a very long time ago)
  • ((Under Greek law, all antiquities that are discovered in Greece belong to the government.::
    根据希腊法律，在希腊发现的所有古物均归政府所有。))

apartheid

/əˈpɑː.taɪt/əˈpɑː.teɪt//əˈpɑːr.taɪt/əˈpɑːr.teɪt/
noun [U]
（旧时南非的）种族隔离制度[英]^(in the past in South Africa, a system under which people of different races were kept separate by law, and white people were given more political rights and educational and other advantages)
  • South Africa finally began to dismantle (= end) apartheid.
  • Archbishop Tutu said that when South Africans were fighting apartheid, they were supported by people worldwide.
  • He was an important leader in the struggle against the apartheid regime.

apostle

/əˈpɒs.əl//əˈpɑː.səl/
noun [C]
（信仰或政治运动的）倡导者，鼓吹者，先驱[英]^(someone who strongly supports a particular belief or political movement)
  • ((an apostle of world peace/liberty::
    世界和平／自由的倡导者))

the Apostles

/əˈpɒs.əl//əˈpɑː.səl/
noun [plural]
the group of early Christians who travelled to different places telling people about Jesus Christ
  • Pentecost is the day the Holy Spirit descended on the Apostles.

appal

/əˈpɔːl//əˈpɑːl/
verb [T]
(US appall)
-ll-
UK
使惊骇;使震惊[英]^(to make someone have strong feelings of shock or of disapproval)
  • ((I was appalled at/by the lack of staff in the hospital.::
    医院里人手之少令我震惊。))
  • ((The state of the kitchen appalled her.::
    厨房的脏乱让她目瞪口呆。))

appraise

/əˈpreɪz//əˈpreɪz/
verb [T]
评定;鉴定;评价[英]^(to examine someone or something in order to judge their qualities, success, or needs)
  • ((At the end of each teaching practice, trainee teachers are asked to appraise their own performance.::
    在每次教学实习结束时，都要求实习教师对自己的表现作自我评定。))
  • ((In cooperation with other professionals, social workers will appraise the individual's needs.::
    社会工作者将与其他专业人士携手合作，对个体的需要作出评估。))
  • ((He coolly appraised the situation, deciding which person would be most likely to succeed.::
    他冷静地审时度势，判断哪个人最可能获得胜利。))
US
(Uk value)
估价[英]^(to give a judgment about how much money something might be sold for)
  • ((The ring was appraised at $40,000.::
    这枚戒指估价为4万美元。))

  • ((The police have finally apprehended the killer.::
    警察终于抓住了凶手。))
领会;理解;懂得[英]^(to understand something)

apprentice

/əˈpren.tɪs//əˈpren.t̬ɪs/
noun [C]
学徒;徒弟[英]^(someone who has agreed to work for a skilled person for a particular period of time and often for low payment, in order to learn that person's skills)
  • ((Most of the work was done by apprentices.::
    大部分活儿是由学徒们做的。))
  • ((an apprentice carpenter::
    木工学徒))

  • ((Michelangelo was apprenticed to Ghirlandaio in Florence for three years.::
    米开朗基罗曾在佛罗伦萨师从吉兰达约三年。))

appropriate

adjective
/əˈprəʊ.pri.ət//əˈproʊ.pri.ət/
B2
适当的，恰当的；合适的[英]^(suitable or right for a particular situation or occasion)
  • ((appropriate footwear for the country::
    适于在乡间穿的鞋))
  • ((Is this film appropriate for small children?::
    这部电影适合幼童观看吗？))
  • ((I didn't think his comments were very appropriate at the time.::
    我觉得他在当时发表那些评论很不妥当。))
  • ((Is this an appropriate occasion to discuss finance?::
    这个场合适于讨论财政问题吗？))
  • ((Please complete the appropriate parts of this form (= the parts that are right or necessary for your particular situation) and return it as soon as possible.::
    请正确填写表中相关部分并尽快交回。))
verb [T]
/əˈprəʊ.pri.eɪt//əˈproʊ.pri.eɪt/
挪用;占用;盗用;侵吞[英]^(to take something for your own use, usually without permission)
  • ((He lost his job when he was found to have appropriated some of the company's money.::
    他被发现侵吞公司钱款后就丢了工作。))
拨出（款项）[英]^(to keep an amount of money to use for a particular purpose)
  • ((The government have appropriated millions of pounds for the project.::
    政府已经为该项目拨款数百万英镑。))

arbitrate

/ˈɑː.bɪ.treɪt//ˈɑːr.bə.treɪt/
verb [I or T]
（通常指在争议方要求下）仲裁，裁决，公断[英]^(to make a judgment in an argument, usually because asked to do so by those involved)
  • ((I've been asked to arbitrate between the opposing sides.::
    对立的双方请我作个公断。))
  • ((An outside adviser has been brought in to arbitrate the dispute between the management and the union.::
    局外顾问受邀对资方和工会之间的争端进行仲裁。))

arc

/ɑːk//ɑːrk/
noun [C]
弧;弧状;弧线;弧形[英]^(the shape of part of a circle, or other curved line)
  • ((The ball rose in a high arc and fell behind the boundary line.::
    球在空中高高地划了一条弧线落在边线外。))
电弧，弧光[英]^(a powerful flow of electricity that goes across a space between two points)
（电影、书籍或电视剧的）故事情节，支线故事[英]^(a complete story or the story of one character, especially one that is part of a larger story in a film, book, or television series)
  • ((Even the minor characters in these films come with their own story arcs.::
    即使是这些电影中的小角色也有自己的故事情节。))
  • ((Films about teachers working with troubled kids tend to follow a predictable arc involving conflict and resolution.::
    关于教师与问题儿童的电影往往遵循这种预料之中的故事情节——发生冲突和解决冲突。))
verb
[I]
循弧线行进;做弧形运动[英]^(to move in the shape of an arc)
  • ((The rocket arced gracefully into the sky.::
    火箭升空，在空中划出一条优美的弧线。))
[I usually + adv/prep]
形成电弧[英]^(to make an electric arc)

    据报道，枪手全副武装，配备了步枪和手枪。))

/ˈɑː.mər//ˈɑːr.mɚ/

(US armor)
UK

  • ((Police put on body armour before confronting the rioters.::
    警察镇压暴徒前穿上了防弹服。))
  • ((In the past, knights used to wear suits of armour (= protective covering made of metal) in battle.::
    在过去，骑士作战时身着甲胄。))
  • ((These grenades are able to pierce the armour of tanks.::
    这些手榴弹可以击穿坦克的装甲。))

  • ((The troops were backed by tanks, artillery, and other heavy armour.::

ascent

/əˈsent//əˈsent/
noun
[C usually singular]
上升;攀登[英]^(the act of climbing or moving upwards)
  • ((She made her first successful ascent of Everest last year.::
    她去年第一次成功攀登了珠穆朗玛峰。))
  • ((As the plane made its ascent, we saw thick smoke coming from one engine.::
    飞机在上升时，我们看到一个引擎中冒出了浓烟。))

  • ((We struggled up the slippery ascent.::
    那段上坡路很滑，我们吃力地向上走。))
[S]
腾达；成功；高升[英]^(the fact of starting to become successful)
  • ((His ascent to power was rapid and unexpected.::
    他出人意料地平步青云。))

/əˈseɪl//əˈseɪl/
verb
[T]
攻击，袭击;抨击[英]^(to attack someone violently or criticize someone strongly)
  • ((The victim had been assailed with repeated blows to the head and body.::
    受害者的头部和身体遭到连续重击。))
  • ((He was assailed with insults and abuse as he left the court.::
    他离开法庭时，遭到众人的辱骂。))
[T often passive]
困扰；使苦恼[英]^(to cause someone to experience a lot of unpleasant things)
  • ((to be assailed by doubts/fears/problems::
    为疑虑／恐惧／问题所困扰))

/əˈsæs.ɪn//əˈsæs.ən/
noun [C]
（通常为政治目的或钱杀死名人或重要人物的）暗杀者，行刺者，刺客[英]^(someone who kills a famous or important person, usually for political reasons or in exchange for money)
  • ((John Lennon's assassin was Mark Chapman.::
    刺杀约翰•列侬的人是马克•查普曼。))
  • ((She hired an assassin to eliminate her rival.::
    她雇用刺客来除掉她的对手。))

  • ((an asthma sufferer::
    哮喘病患者))
  • Medics tended to a boy who was having an asthma attack.

[U]

  • ((to seek/apply for political asylum::

[C]

  • ((a lunatic asylum::

asymmetry

/eɪˈsɪm.ə.tri//eɪˈsɪm.ə.tri/
noun [C or U]
不对称;不匀称[英]^(the state of two halves, sides, or parts that are not exactly the same in shape or size)
  • ((The brain scan showed a hemispheric asymmetry.::
    脑部扫描显示大脑半球的不对称。))
  • ((Physicists are investigating the apparent asymmetry in the amounts of matter and antimatter in the universe.::
    物理学家正在研究宇宙中物质和反物质数量的明显不对称性。))
不对等;不均衡[英]^(the condition of not being equal or equally available between two people or groups)
  • ((power/information asymmetries::
    权力/信息的不对等))
  • ((Economic asymmetry between the rich and the poor has worsened in recent years.::
    近年来，贫富之间的经济不均衡现象更加严重。))

audible

/ˈɔː.də.bəl//ˈɑː.də.bəl/
adjective
可以听到的，听得见的[英]^(able to be heard)
  • ((The lecturer spoke so quietly that he was scarcely audible at the back of the hall.::
    这位讲师的声音太小，坐在礼堂后面的人几乎听不见。))
  • ((She gave an audible sigh of relief.::
    大家听到她如释重负地舒了一口气。))

audition

/ɔːˈdɪʃ.ən//ɑːˈdɪʃ.ən/
noun [C]
C1
（演员、乐手、舞蹈演员等的）试镜;试奏;试唱;试演[英]^(a short performance that an actor, musician, dancer, etc. gives in order to show they are suitable for a particular play, film, show, etc.)
  • ((His audition went well and he's fairly hopeful about getting the part.::
    他试镜时表现出色，很有希望获得这个角色。))
  • ((The director is holding auditions next week for the major parts.::
    导演将在下周举行试演，以确定主要角色的人选。))
verb [I or T]
（使）试镜;（使）试奏;（使）试唱;（使）试演[英]^(to give a short performance in order to show that you are suitable for a part in a film, play, show, etc., or to make someone do this)
  • ((I'm auditioning for the part of Lady Macbeth.::
    我将参加试演，看能否出演麦克白夫人这个角色。))
  • ((We're auditioning local rock bands for the music festival.::
    我们正在听当地的摇滚乐队试唱，以遴选出佼佼者去参加音乐节。))

aura

/ˈɔː.rə//ˈɔːr.ə/
noun [C]
气氛，氛围；气息[英]^(a feeling or character that a person or place seems to have)
  • ((The woods have an aura of mystery.::
    这片树林透着神秘的气息。))
  • ((There's an aura of sadness about him.::
    他看上去一副悲伤的样子。))
（一些人声称在人或动物身体周围看到的）光环，光轮[英]^(a type of light that some people say they can see around people and animals)

austere

/ɔːˈstɪər//ɑːˈstɪr/
adjective
简朴的；艰苦的；朴素的[英]^(very simple, with only the things that are absolutely necessary, especially because of severe limits on money or goods)
  • ((an austere childhood during the war::
    战火中艰苦的童年生活))
不加修饰的，无装饰的[英]^(plain and without decoration or unnecessary details)
  • ((The courtroom was a large, dark chamber, an austere place.::
    法庭是一个大而阴暗的房间，朴实无华。))
严厉的;严峻的[英]^(very severe and unfriendly in manner)
  • ((He was a tall, austere, forbidding figure.::
    他身材高大，神色严肃，令人生畏。))

authoritarian

/ˌɔː.θɒr.ɪˈteə.ri.ən//əˌθɔːr.əˈter.i.ən/
adjective
独裁的;专制的[英]^(demanding that people obey completely and refusing to allow them freedom to act as they wish)
  • ((an authoritarian regime/government/ruler::
    独裁政权／政府／统治者))
  • ((His manner is extremely authoritarian.::
    他的作风极其专断。))

autobiography

/ˌɔː.tə.baɪˈɒɡ.rə.fi//ˌɑː.t̬ə.baɪˈɑː.ɡrə.fi/

[C]

  • ((Tony Blair's autobiography was a bestseller.::
    托尼·布莱尔的自传曾十分畅销。))
[U]

  • ((His life story is recounted in two fascinating volumes of autobiography.::
    两部引人入胜的自传描述了他的生平经历。))

aye

adverb
/aɪ//aɪ/
Northern English, Scottish English
是，是的（yes 的另一种说法）[英]^(another word for "yes")
  • (("Would you prefer not to work?" "Oh aye, I'd stop tomorrow if I could."::
    “你想要不工作吗？”“哦，是的。如果可以的话我明天就不想上班。”))
  • ((All those who support this proposal say "Aye".::
    支持这项提议的人请说“赞成”。))
noun [C]
/aɪ//aɪ/
UK
赞成票;投赞成票者[英]^(especially in the UK parliament, a vote to support a suggestion, idea, law, etc., or a person who votes "yes")
  • Points of order are divided into ayes and noes.
  • The ayes are 57; the nays are 44.

/beɪb//beɪb/

  • ((a newborn babe::

  • ((It's up to you, babe. I'll do whatever you say.::
    宝贝，你来决定吧。你说什么我就做什么。))

    他可真是个帅小伙。))

bacterium

/bækˈtɪə.ri.əm//bækˈtɪr.i.əm/bækˈtɪə.ri.ə/bækˈtɪr.i.ə/
noun [C usually plural]
plural bacteria
C1
细菌[英]^(a type of very small organism that lives in air, earth, water, plants, and animals, often one that causes disease)
  • ((an illness caused by bacteria in drinking water::

  • ((The bacterium Streptococcus pneumoniae causes about a third of some 3,000 annual meningitis cases.::
    在每年约3000起脑膜炎病例中，1/3左右是由一种叫“肺炎链球菌”的细菌引起的。))

barge

  • ((They barged through the crowds.::
    他们在人群中横冲直撞。))
  • ((When the doors opened she barged her way to the front of the queue.::
    门一开她就冲到了队伍的前面。))
  • ((The man barged (= pushed) into her and ran on without stopping.::
    那个男人撞上她后停也没停接着就跑了。))

  • The state operates passenger ferries and cargo barges to the island.

    他唱男低音。))
  • ((Italy's leading bass::
    意大利头号男低音))

  • ((Turn down the bass.::
    把低音调低。))

  • He played bass in a band.

  • I was the bass player.
[C or U]

  • He taught me to play the bass.
  • She plays bass and cello in a folk ensemble.

/beɪs//beɪs/

  • He launched his little boat to fish for bass.

/ˈbɑː.stəd//ˈbæs.tɚd/

  • ((He was a bastard to his wife.::
    他对妻子很坏。))
  • ((You lied to me, you bastard!::
    你这个混蛋，竟对我撒谎！))
  • ((You won again? You lucky bastard! (= I don't think you deserve it)::
    你又赢了？你这个走运的家伙！))
  • ((This crossword's a bastard (= very difficult).::
    这个纵横字谜太难了。))

    他生于1798年，是个乡绅与其情妇的私生子。))

beckon

/ˈbek.ən//ˈbek.ən/
verb
[I or T]
（向…）点头；（向…）招手；（向…）打手势[英]^(to move your hand or head in a way that tells someone to come nearer)
  • ((The customs official beckoned the woman to his counter.::
    海关官员示意那个妇女到他桌前来。))
  • (("Hey you!" she called, beckoning me over with her finger.::
    “嘿，叫你呢！”她喊道，并用手指示意我过去。))
  • ((He beckoned to me, as if he wanted to speak to me.::
    他给我打手势，好像是要跟我说什么。))
[I]
吸引;引诱[英]^(If something beckons, it attracts people.)
  • ((For many young people, the bright lights of the city beckon, though a lot of them end up sleeping on the streets.::
    城市璀璨的灯火吸引了许多年轻人，然而其中许多人却最终落得露宿街头。))
[I]
有可能发生;召唤[英]^(If an event or achievement beckons, it is likely to happen.)
  • ((She's an excellent student, for whom a wonderful future beckons.::
    她是个优秀的学生，美妙的前程向她召唤。))

noun [C]

    像其他联星一样，这两颗恒星似乎被引力约束，相互围绕着对方运转。))

    胡克在1664年发现白羊座5是一颗联星。))

  • ((Gary's had his hair bleached.::

  • ((New shoes always give me blisters.::
    新鞋总会把我的脚磨出疱。))

/blɒkˈeɪd//blɑːˈkeɪd/
noun [C]
封锁[英]^(the situation in which a country or place is surrounded by soldiers or ships to stop people or goods from going in or out)
  • ((an air and sea blockade::
    空中及海上封锁))
  • ((The Soviet blockade of Berlin was lifted in May 1949.::
    苏联对柏林的封锁于1949年5月解除。))
  • ((There is still some hope that the economic blockade will work and make military intervention unnecessary.::
    经济封锁仍有望发挥作用，这样就不必采取军事干预。))

noun [C]

  • ((an ink blot::
    墨水渍))
verb [T]
-tt-
吸干;搌干[英]^(to dry a wet surface, or writing done in ink, by pressing something soft against it)
  • ((I signed my name and blotted the paper.::
    我签完名后把纸上的墨吸干。))
  • ((She put on her lipstick and then carefully blotted her lips with a tissue.::
    她涂上口红，然后小心地用纸巾搌了搌嘴唇。))
弄上污渍;涂污，弄脏[英]^(to make a blot or blots on something)

bluff

/blʌf//blʌf/
verb [I or T]
虚张声势;吓唬[英]^(to deceive someone by making them think either that you are going to do something when you really have no intention of doing it, or that you have knowledge that you do not really have, or that you are someone else)
  • ((Is he going to jump or is he only bluffing?::
    他是真要跳还是只是吓唬人？))
  • ((Tony seems to know a lot about music, but sometimes I think he's only bluffing.::
    托尼似乎对音乐很了解，但有时我觉得他只是在装样子。))
  • ((She bluffed the doorman into thinking that she was a reporter.::
    她装模作样让门卫以为她是记者。))
noun
[C or U]
虚张声势;吓唬[英]^(an attempt to bluff)
  • ((When she said she was leaving him, he thought it was only a bluff.::
    当她说要离开他时，他以为那只是吓唬他。))
[C]
悬崖，峭壁;陡岸[英]^(a cliff or very steep bank)
adjective
过分直率的;过于直接的[英]^(direct or too honest, often in a way that people find rude)
  • ((Despite her bluff manner, she's actually a very kind woman.::
    尽管有点过于直率，但她实际上是个很善良的女人。))

/blʌf//blʌf/
verb [I or T]

  • ((How did Mina manage to bluff her way into that job?::
    米娜究竟是怎样蒙混过关得到那份工作的？))

    我填好了预订表格后寄出。))

bowl

/bəʊl//boʊl/
noun [C]
A2
碗;钵[英]^(a round container that is open at the top and is deep enough to hold fruit, sugar, etc.)
  • ((a soup/cereal/salad/sugar bowl::
    汤碗／麦片粥碗／色拉钵／糖钵))
  • ((a bowl of soup/rice/porridge::
    一碗汤／米饭／粥))
  • ((She eats a bowl (= the contents of a bowl) of cereal every morning.::
    她每天早上吃一碗麦片粥。))
  • ((Sift the flour and baking powder into a mixing bowl.::
    将面粉和发酵粉筛进搅拌钵里。))
  • ((Just put the dirty dishes in the washing-up bowl, and I'll do them later.::
    将脏碟子放进洗碗盆好了，我一会儿再洗。))
（物体的）碗状部分[英]^(the rounded inside part of something)
  • ((The toilet bowl was cracked and stained, and the walls were covered in mould.::
    抽水马桶破裂了，污迹斑斑，四周墙上到处都是霉点。))

  • ((the Hollywood Bowl::
    好莱坞露天剧场))

  • ((He ate a whole box of chocolates.::
    他吃了整整一盒巧克力。))

  • ((If you would like more information, put an X in the box.::
    如果你需要更多的信息，请在这个方框内打钩。))

  • ((a jury/phone box::

[C]

  • ((Can you see Prince Charles in the royal box?::

[C]
(also PO box)

[I or T]

  • ((He used to box every weekend.::
    他以前每个周末都打拳击。))

    我曾和一些最好的拳击手较量过。))

  • ((I boxed up some clothes and books to donate to charity.::

brew

/bruː//bruː/
verb
[T]
酿（啤酒）[英]^(to make beer)
[I or T]
泡（茶）;煮（咖啡）;（茶）冲泡;（咖啡）煮[英]^(If you brew tea or coffee, you add boiling water to it to make a hot drink, and if it brews, it gradually develops flavour in the container in which it was made.)
  • ((He brewed us some coffee./He brewed some coffee for us.::
    他给我们煮了些咖啡。))
[I]
（坏事或暴风雨）即将来临，酝酿[英]^(If an unpleasant situation or a storm is brewing, you feel that it is about to happen.)
  • ((It was too quiet - I felt that trouble was brewing.::
    太安静了——我觉得要出事了。))
  • ((A storm was brewing in the distance.::
    远处一场暴风雨即将来临。))
noun
[C]
（尤指某地或某个时间酿造的）啤酒[英]^(a type of beer, especially one made in a particular place or at a particular time)
[C usually singular] UK
一杯茶;一份啤酒[英]^(a drink of tea or a drink of beer)
  • ((Make us a brew, Bren.::
    布伦，给我们泡杯茶吧。))
[C]
混合物[英]^(a mixture of several things)
  • ((They gave her a strange brew to drink.::
    他们让她喝一种奇怪的混合饮料。))
  • ((War, with its fear, its deprivation, its excitement and violence makes for a very heady brew (= powerful combination).::
    战争是恐惧、剥夺、刺激和暴力诸因素的混合体，给人以强烈震撼。))

brief

/briːf//briːf/
adjective
B1
短暂的;简短的[英]^(lasting only a short time or containing few words)
  • ((His acceptance speech was mercifully brief.::
    幸而他的获奖感言很简短。))
  • ((I had a brief look at her report before the meeting.::
    会前我浏览了一下她的报告。))
  • ((It'll only be a brief visit because we really don't have much time.::
    我们的时间真的不多，所以只能作短暂的参观游览。))
  • ((After a brief spell/stint in the army, he started working as a teacher.::
    在部队呆了短暂的一段时间以后，他当起了教师。))
  • ((The company issued a brief statement about yesterday's accident.::
    那家公司就昨天的事故发表了简短的声明。))
（时间）短暂的，飞快的[英]^(used to express how quickly time goes past)
  • ((For a few brief weeks we were very happy.::
    在短短的几周里，我们过得十分愉快。))
（衣服）很短的[英]^((of clothes) very short)
  • ((She was wearing a fairly brief skirt, as I recall.::
    我记得她当时穿了件非常短的裙子。))
verb [T]
向…介绍情况;给…指示[英]^(to give someone detailed instructions or information)
  • ((We had already been briefed about/on what the job would entail.::
    已经有人向我们介绍了工作内容。))
noun
[C] UK
指示；（任务）简介[英]^(a set of instructions or information)
  • ((It was my brief to make sure that the facts were set down accurately.::
    我的要求是确保准确记录所有事实。))
[C] • LAW
诉讼要点;案情摘要[英]^(a document or set of documents containing the details about a court case)
UK
（出庭）律师[英]^(a lawyer who will speak for someone in a court of law)
  • ((My brief advised me to plead guilty.::
    我的律师建议我认罪。))

    她把玻璃杯倒满。))

    她递给他杯子，里面装满热腾腾的黑咖啡。))

-mm-
注满，装满（尤指液体）[英]^(to become full of something, especially a liquid)
  • ((Her eyes brimmed with tears when she heard that he was alive.::
    当她听说他活着时，眼里噙满了泪水。))
  • ((His recent triumphs have left the tennis ace brimming (over) with (= full of) confidence and energy.::
    最近的几次胜利使这位网球高手充满信心和活力。))

    科学家们就快有新的重大发现了。))

    她就站在峡谷的边缘。))

  • ((The old woman had a few grey bristles sprouting from her chin.::

  • ((The best quality men's shaving brushes are made from badger bristle.::

    我的牙刷上有蓝白塑料刷毛。))

（毛发等）直立[英]^((of hair) to stand up)
  • ((The cat's fur bristled and it arched its back.::
    那只猫竖起了毛，弓起了背。))

  • ((She bristled at the suggestion that she had in any way neglected the child.::
    人们认为她多少有点忽略了这孩子，这种看法使她很生气。))

/bruːd//bruːd/
noun [C]
一窝雏鸟[英]^(a group of young birds all born at the same time)
  • ((The blackbird flew back and forth to its brood.::
    乌鸫飞来飞去的，忙于哺育幼雏。))
…的孩子[英]^(a person's young children)
  • ((Ann was at the party with her brood.::
    安和她的孩子们参加了聚会。))

  • ((I wish she wouldn't sit brooding in her room all day.::
    我希望她不要整天呆在房间里忧心忡忡的。))

brute

noun [C]

  • ((Take your hands off me, you brute!::
    把手松开，你这畜牲！))

  • ((Your dog's an ugly brute, isn't it?::
    你那条狗是个丑陋的家伙，对吧？))
  • ((The oldest elephant was lame, poor brute.::
    那头最老的大象腿跛了，可怜的家伙。))

  • ((In the end she used brute force to push him out.::
    最后她使出吃奶的力气将他推了出去。))

  • ((Her bags were bulging with shopping.::
    她的袋子鼓鼓的，装满了买来的东西。))
noun [C]
凸起；鼓起[英]^(a curved shape sticking out from the surface of something)
  • ((I wondered what the bulge in her coat pocket was.::
    我想知道她大衣口袋里鼓鼓的是什么东西。))
暂时的激增；突然上涨[英]^(a sudden increase that soon returns to the usual level)
  • ((There was a bulge in spending in the early part of the year.::
    年初时开支曾出现突然上涨。))

bum

乞丐[英]^(someone who has no home or job and lives by asking other people for money)
adjective [before noun]
劣质的；无用的[英]^(bad in quality or not useful)
  • ((He gave us bum directions, but we eventually found the place.::
    他给我们指错了路，但是我们最后还是找到了那个地方。))
verb [T]
-mm-
乞讨;讨要[英]^(to ask someone for something without intending to pay for it)
  • ((Could I bum a cigarette off you?::
    我能向你讨根烟吗？))

  • ((a cinnamon bun::

    她将头发挽成一个圆发髻。))

/bɔɪ//bɔɪ//ˈbuː.i/
noun [C]

verb
[T]
使浮起[英]^(to prevent someone or something from sinking)
  • ((The very salty water buoyed her (up) as she swam.::
    她游泳时，含盐量非常高的水使她漂浮了起来。))
[T usually passive]
鼓舞；鼓励，使…更自信[英]^(to make someone feel happier or more confident about a situation)
  • ((She was buoyed (up) by the warm reception her audience gave her.::
    观众们热烈的欢迎使她倍受鼓舞。))
[T usually passive]
支持;使更成功[英]^(to support something and make it more successful)
  • ((House prices have been buoyed (up) in the area by the possibility of a new factory opening.::
    因为可能有一家新工厂在此开设，所以该地区的房价一直居高不下。))

verb [T]
(US usually burglarize, uk Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /ˈbɜː.ɡlər.aɪz/ us Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /ˈbɝː.ɡlə.raɪz/)

burrow

/ˈbʌr.əʊ//ˈbɝː.oʊ/
noun [C]
（尤指动物挖掘居住的）洞穴，地道[英]^(a hole in the ground dug by an animal such as a rabbit, especially to live in)
verb
[I usually + adv/prep]
（尤指为居住）打洞，掘洞[英]^(to dig a hole in the ground, especially to live in)
  • ((Rats had burrowed into the bank of the river.::
    老鼠在河岸上打了洞。))
[T + adv/prep]
（舒适、温暖或安全地）躲进，钻入；偎依[英]^(to move yourself into a position where you can feel warm, comfortable, or safe)
  • ((Suddenly shy, our young daughter burrowed her head into my shoulder.::
    我们的小女儿突然感到害羞了，将头靠在我的肩膀上。))
[I + adv/prep]
翻找，搜寻[英]^(to search for something, as if by digging)
  • ((I burrowed through the clothes in the drawer looking for a clean pair of socks.::
    我在抽屉里的衣服里翻找一双干净的袜子。))

bust

/bʌst//bʌst/
noun [C]

  • ((I couldn't find any blouses in my bust size.::
    我找不到适合我胸围的衬衫。))

  • ((There was a bust of Mahler on his desk.::
    他书桌上有一尊马勒的半身像。))

  • ((In their latest drugs bust police entered a warehouse where cocaine dealers were meeting.::
    在最近的毒品搜捕行动中，警方突袭了一个可卡因毒贩正在进行交易的仓库。))
verb [T]
busted UK also bust | busted UK also bust

  • ((Oh no! I bust his MP3 player.::
    噢，不好！我弄坏了他的MP3播放机。))
US

  • ((The police busted him because they think he's involved with a terrorist group.::
    警方认为他与恐怖团伙有牵连而逮捕了他。))
adjective
(US busted)
UK
坏的，损坏的[英]^(broken)
  • ((I think my watch is bust.::
    我想我的表坏了。))

censor

/ˈsen.sər//ˈsen.sɚ/
noun [C]
（书籍、电影等的）审查员，审查官；（尤指战时或监狱中私人书信的）检查员[英]^(a person responsible for examining books, films, works of art, or communications, and deciding whether to prevent parts or the whole of them from being seen or made available to the public because they are considered to be offensive or harmful, or because they contain information that someone wishes to keep secret, often for political reasons)
  • Military censors prevented the publication of some details.
  • a government censor
verb [T]
审查（对书，电影等进行删改，以筛除当中冒犯粗劣的内容，也指对战时或监狱中私人书信的检查，删除其中不当的部分）[英]^(to prevent part or the whole of a book, film, work of art, document, or other kind of communication from being seen or made available to the public, because it is considered to be offensive or harmful, or because it contains information that someone wishes to keep secret, often for political reasons)
  • ((The book was heavily censored when first published.::
    这本书首次出版时经过了严格的审查。))
  • Is it possible to censor the internet?

/tʃeər//tʃer/

    他在二十世纪初被任命为剑桥大学物理系主任。))

  • ((Would you like to chair tomorrow's meeting?::
    你愿意主持明天的会议吗？))

/ˈtʃɑː.kəʊl//ˈtʃɑːr.koʊl/

  • ((charcoal for the barbecue::
    烧烤用的木炭))

charisma

/kəˈrɪz.mə//kəˈrɪz.mə/
noun [U]
C2
超凡的个人魅力;吸引力;超凡气质[英]^(a special power that some people have naturally that makes them able to influence other people and attract their attention and admiration)
  • ((On screen Garbo had this great charisma so that you couldn't take your eyes off her.::
    在银幕上，嘉宝魅力非凡，让人无法将眼光从她身上移开。))
  • ((How did a man of so little personal charisma get to be prime minister?::
    一个如此缺乏个人魅力的人是怎么成为首相的？))

chatter

/ˈtʃæt.ər//ˈtʃæt̬.ɚ/
verb [I]
唠叨;喋喋不休[英]^(to talk for a long time about things that are not important)
  • ((She spent the morning chattering away to her friends.::
    她和朋友闲聊了一上午。))
  • ((He chattered happily about nothing in particular.::
    他喋喋不休，却没讲什么特别的东西。))
（指动物）叽叽喳喳，吱吱叫，咯咯叫[英]^(If animals chatter, they make quick, repeated noises.)
  • ((The gun shot made the monkeys chatter in alarm.::
    枪声使那群猴子惊慌地吱吱乱叫。))
（牙齿因受冷或受惊而）咯咯作响，打战[英]^(If your teeth chatter, they knock together repeatedly because you are very cold or frightened.)
  • ((I could hardly talk, my teeth were chattering so much.::
    我几乎说不了话，牙齿不停地打战。))
noun [U]
喋喋不休的谈话;唠叨[英]^(conversation about things that are not important)
  • ((I can't concentrate with Ann's constant chatter.::
    安一直唠唠叨叨，我没法集中精力。))
（动物的）鸣叫声，啁啾声，吱吱的叫声[英]^(the quick, repeated noises that some animals make)
  • ((He could hear the chatter of birds in the trees overhead.::
    他可以听见鸟儿在头顶的树上叽叽喳喳的叫声。))
网上的交流[英]^(communication between people over the internet)
  • ((Experts monitor internet chatter for the government.::
    政府雇用的专家监视人们在网上的交流内容。))

chestnut

/ˈtʃes.nʌt//ˈtʃes.nʌt/
noun
[C] US
(UK sweet chestnut)
plural also chestnut
栗树[英]^(a large tree with leaves divided into five parts and large, round nuts)
  • ((a 200-year-old chestnut tree::
    有200年树龄的栗树))
  • ((forests full of oak and chestnut::
    长满橡树和栗子树的森林))
栗子，板栗[英]^(a large, brown nut that grows on a sweet chestnut tree, often cooked and eaten hot)
  • ((A man in the street was selling bags of roast chestnuts.::
    街上有个人在卖成袋的炒栗子。))
[C]
栗色马;红棕马[英]^(a reddish-brown horse)
[U]
栗色，红褐色，红棕色[英]^(a reddish-brown colour)
adjective
栗色的，红褐色的，红棕色的[英]^(reddish-brown in colour)

chilli

/ˈtʃɪl.i//ˈtʃɪl.i/
noun [C or U]
plural chilies
A2 UK
(US chili plural chilies)
辣椒[英]^(the small, red or green seed case from particular types of pepper plant that is used to make some foods spicy)
  • ((Add 2 chopped red chillies.::
    加入两根切成块的辣椒。))
  • I like to add a bit of green chilli.
  • chilli sauce/oil
UK
(US chili plural chilies); (also chilli con carne)
辣味肉豆（一道菜肴）[英]^(a spicy dish of meat, onions, chillies or chilli powder, and usually beans)
  • ((His favourite food is chilli.::
    辣味肉豆是他喜欢的食品。))
  • ((I've made a chilli for tonight.::
    今天晚上我做了辣味肉豆。))

chimpanzee

(informal chimp, /tʃɪmp/ /tʃɪmp/)

chord

/kɔːd//kɔːrd/
noun [C]
（音乐的）和弦，和音[英]^(three or more musical notes played at the same time)
  • ((She strummed a few chords on her guitar.::
    她在吉他上弹了几个和弦。))
  • ((a C major chord::
    C大调和弦))
弦(连接圆上任意两点的线段)[英]^(a straight line that joins the ends of an arc (= a curved line that forms part of a circle))

choreograph

/ˈkɒr.i.ə.ɡrɑːf//ˈkɔːr.i.ə.ɡræf/
verb [T]
编舞;设计舞蹈动作[英]^(to plan the combination of movements to be performed in a dance)
  • ((The ballet was choreographed by Ashton.::
    这部芭蕾舞剧由阿什顿编舞。))
  • ((She continues to choreograph new dances for her company, although she rarely performs anymore.::
    尽管她已经很少表演了，但她继续为她的公司编排新的舞蹈。))
精心设计（活动等）[英]^(to plan an event or course of action very carefully)
  • ((The carefully choreographed ceremony emphasized the governor's focus on education.::
    精心编排的仪式强调了州长对教育的重视。))
  • ((The announcement was elaborately choreographed.::
    该公告得到了精心设计。))

chromosome

/ˈkrəʊ.mə.səʊm//ˈkroʊ.mə.soʊm/
noun [C]
染色体[英]^(any of the rod-like structures found in all living cells, containing the chemical patterns that control what an animal or plant is like)
  • ((X and Y chromosomes::
    X染色体和Y染色体))
  • ((sex chromosomes::
    性别染色体))

chronicle

/ˈkrɒn.ɪ.kəl//ˈkrɑː.nɪ.kəl/
noun [C]
编年史;年代记;大事记[英]^(a written record of historical events)
  • ((the Anglo-Saxon Chronicle::
    《盎格鲁-撒克逊人编年史》))
  • ((a chronicle of the French Revolution::
    法国大革命编年史))
（报纸名称）…新闻，…记事报[英]^(part of the name of a newspaper)
  • ((the Hampshire Chronicle::
    《汉普郡记事报》))
verb [T]
记述，记录（大事）;把…载入编年史[英]^(to make a record or give details of something)
  • ((The book chronicles the writer's coming to terms with his illness.::
    这本书记述了作者慢慢学会忍受自己病痛的前后过程。))

chronology

/krəˈnɒl.ə.dʒi//krəˈnɑː.lə.dʒi/
noun [C or U]
按事件发生的年代排列的顺序;（大事）年表[英]^(the order in which a series of events happened, or a list or explanation of these events in the order in which they happened)
  • ((I'm not sure of the chronology of events.::
    我对事件发生的时间顺序不是很有把握。))

chuck

/tʃʌk//tʃʌk/
verb
[T often + adv/prep]
（随便地）扔，抛，甩[英]^(to throw something carelessly)
  • ((Chuck it over there/into the corner.::
    把它扔到那儿／角落里就行了。))
  • ((Chuck me the keys.::
    把钥匙扔给我。))
[T] UK
断绝（恋爱关系）;甩掉（某人）[英]^(to end a romantic relationship with someone)
  • ((He's just chucked his girlfriend.::
    他刚甩了女朋友。))
noun
Northern
(also chuckie, /ˈtʃʌk.i/ /ˈtʃʌk.i/)
（友好的称呼）宝贝[英]^(a friendly form of address)
  • (("All right, then, chuck?"::
    “那么，行吗，宝贝儿？”))
[C] • ENGINEERING
（机器上固定某物的）卡盘，夹盘[英]^(a device for holding an object firmly in a machine)

chuckle

/ˈtʃʌk.əl//ˈtʃʌk.əl/
verb [I]
哧哧地笑;轻声笑;暗自笑[英]^(to laugh quietly)
  • ((She was chuckling as she read the letter.::
    她边看信边偷着笑。))

churn

/tʃɜːn//tʃɝːn/
verb
[T]
(also churn up)
剧烈搅动（尤指液体）;翻搅;使猛烈翻腾[英]^(to move something, especially a liquid, with great force)
  • ((The sea was churned up by heavy winds.::
    狂风搅得大海白浪滔天。))
[T]
用搅乳器搅拌（牛奶以制成黄油）[英]^(to mix milk until it becomes butter)
[I]
（通常指由于紧张而）胃部翻腾，反胃，恶心[英]^(If your stomach is churning, you feel ill, usually because you are nervous.)
  • ((I had my driving test that morning and my stomach was churning.::
    参加驾照考试的那天早上，我的胃里一直在翻腾。))
[I or T] • BUSINESS
（顾客）辗转光顾提供某种商品（或服务）的不同公司[英]^(If customers churn between different companies that provide a particular service, they change repeatedly from one to another.)
noun
[C] UK
(also milk churn, milk can)
奶罐，奶桶;搅乳器[英]^(a large container for transporting milk)
  • I used to collect a few churns of milk from my brother's farm to make cheese.
  • One of Houdini's most famous tricks was escaping from a padlocked milk churn.
[S or U] • BUSINESS
(also churn rate)
（客户）流失率[英]^(the number of customers who decide to stop using a service offered by one company and to use another company, usually because it offers a better service or price)
  • ((Internet and cable television companies suffer from a high churn rate.::
    互联网公司和有线电视公司的用户流失率很高。))

civic

/ˈsɪv.ɪk//ˈsɪv.ɪk/
adjective [before noun]
城镇的;城市的;市民的[英]^(of a town or city or the people who live in it)
  • ((The prime minister met many civic leaders, including the mayor and the leaders of the immigrant communities.::
    首相接见了许多市政领导，包括市长和移民社团的领导人。))
  • ((She felt it was her civic duty (= her duty as a person living in the town) to tell the police.::
    她觉得把这件事告诉警察是她作为市民应尽的义务。))
  • ((The opera house is a great source of civic pride.::
    该歌剧院是市民的一大骄傲。))

clamp

/klæmp//klæmp/
noun [C]
夹具;夹钳;夹子[英]^(a device made of wood or metal that is used to hold two things together tightly)
  • ((Carefully tighten the clamp until it firmly supports the pipette in a vertical position.::
    小心翼翼地把夹子夹紧，直到能把吸液管牢牢地垂直固定住为止。))
verb
[T usually + adv/prep]
（用夹具）夹紧，夹住[英]^(to fasten two things together, using a clamp)
  • ((Clamp the two pieces of wood (together) for 15 minutes.::
    把两块木片紧紧夹在一起，夹15分钟。))
[T] UK
(US boot)
用夹锁锁住（违章停放车辆的车轮）[英]^(If the police or another person in authority clamps a vehicle, they fix a metal device to one of its wheels, usually because it is parked illegally. The device is usually only removed when the owner pays an amount of money.)
  • ((When I finally got back, I found my car had been clamped.::
    等我终于赶回来时，发现我的车已被车轮夹锁给锁住了。))
[T + adv/prep]
紧紧抓住；牢牢固定住[英]^(If you clamp something in a particular place, you hold it there tightly.)
  • ((He clamped his hand over her mouth.::
    他用手死死地捂住她的嘴巴。))
  • ((A heavy iron chain was clamped around his wrists.::
    沉重的铁铐紧紧地锁住了他的手腕。))

clan

/klæn//klæn/
noun [C, + sing/pl verb]
（尤指苏格兰的）宗族，氏族[英]^(a group of families, especially in Scotland, who originally came from the same family and have the same name)
家族，氏族;（享有共同利益的）群体，集团[英]^(a large family, or a group of people who share the same interest)
  • ((Is/Are the whole clan coming to visit you for Christmas?::
    你那一大帮亲戚圣诞节都要来看望你吗？))

clatter

/ˈklæt.ər//ˈklæt̬.ɚ/
verb [I or T]
（使）发出响亮的撞击声;（使）哐啷作响[英]^(to make continuous loud noises by hitting hard objects against each other, or to cause objects to do this)
  • ((Don't clatter the dishes - you'll wake the baby up.::
    别把碗碟碰得叮当响——会把宝宝吵醒的。))
  • ((He was clattering away at his keyboard.::
    他在键盘上咔嗒咔嗒打东西。))

cleanse

/klenz//klenz/
verb [T]
清洗;使清洁[英]^(to make something completely clean)
  • ((Cleanse the cut/wound thoroughly before you bandage it.::
    打绷带之前要彻底清洗伤口。))
使（道德上）纯洁；使净化[英]^(to make someone or something morally clean or pure)
  • ((to cleanse the thoughts of our hearts::
    净化我们的心灵))
  • ((Roman Catholics go to confession to be cleansed of their sins.::
    罗马天主教徒用忏悔来涤除自己的罪恶。))
  • ((The mayor has promised to cleanse the city of drug dealers (= to remove them from the city).::
    市长承诺要肃清城市里的毒贩。))

cleave

/kliːv//kliːv/
verb [I]
cleaved US also clove | cleaved US also cloven
劈开；（使）裂开；（使）分开[英]^(to separate or divide, or cause something to separate or divide, often violently)
  • ((With one blow of the knight's axe, he clove the rock in twain (= into two pieces).::
    武士大斧一挥，将石头劈成了两半。))

clench

/klentʃ//klentʃ/
verb [T]
（常指坚决或生气地）捏紧，握紧，咬紧[英]^(to close or hold something very tightly, often in a determined or angry way)
  • ((The old man clenched his fist and waved it angrily at us.::
    那老头紧握着拳头，气哼哼地向我们挥舞着。))
  • ((With a knife clenched in/between his teeth, he climbed up the tree to cut some coconuts.::
    他嘴里紧咬着一把刀，爬上树去割椰子。))
  • (("Get out of here," she said through clenched teeth.::
    “滚出去，”她咬牙切齿地说。))

clinch

/klɪntʃ//klɪntʃ/
verb [T]
获得;最终赢得;达成[英]^(to finally get or win something)
  • ((I hear he finally clinched the deal to buy the land he wanted.::
    我听说他最终做成了这笔交易，买到了他想要的地。))
noun [C]
（打架时的）扭抱；（表示亲热时的）拥抱[英]^(the position two people are in when they are holding each other tightly in their arms, when fighting or showing love)

clinch it

/klɪntʃ//klɪntʃ/
verb
他们说这份工作有机会去巴黎，她便决心接受这份工作。[英]^(to make someone decide what to do after a lot of thought or discussion)
  • ((When they said the job would involve travelling to Paris, that clinched it (for her) (= that made her certain that she wanted the job).::
    他们说这份工作有机会去巴黎，她便决心接受这份工作。))

closed

/kləʊzd//kloʊzd/
adjective
A1
关闭的，不开的[英]^(not open)
  • ((It might be less draughty if the door were closed.::
    把门关上可能就不会有那么强的穿堂风了。))
A1
关门的;不营业的[英]^(not open for business)
  • ((All the shops were closed, so we couldn't buy any food.::
    所有的商店都关门了，所以我们什么吃的也买不到。))
完成的；结束的[英]^(finished and therefore not able to be discussed any more)
  • (("The matter is closed," said the headteacher.::
    “这件事到此为止，”校长说道。))
C2
僵化的，不接受新思想的;闭关排外的[英]^(not wanting to accept new ideas, people, customs, etc.)
  • ((You have such a closed mind.::
    你脑子太僵化了。))
  • ((The setting of the novel is the closed world of banking.::
    这部小说的背景是排外的银行界。))

closure

/ˈkləʊ.ʒər//ˈkloʊ.ʒɚ/
noun
C2 [C]
停业，倒闭，关闭[英]^(the fact of a business, organization, etc. stopping operating)
  • ((factory/branch closures::
    工厂／分店的关闭))
  • ((Many elderly people will be affected by the library closures.::
    许多老人将会受到图书馆关闭的影响。))
[U]
解脱，宽慰[英]^(the feeling or act of bringing an unpleasant situation, time, or experience to an end, so that you are able to start new activities)
  • ((a sense of closure::
    解脱感))
  • ((to achieve/reach closure::
    获得／达到解脱))

clove

/kləʊv//kloʊv/
noun
[C]

  • ((This recipe takes four cloves of garlic.::
    这份食谱需要4瓣蒜。))
[C or U]
（用作调味品的）丁香，干丁香花苞[英]^(a small, dark brown dried flower of an evergreen tree (= one that never loses its leaves), used as a spice)
  • ((The ham was studded with cloves.::
    火腿上撒满了丁香花苞。))
  • ((sweet spices such as ginger and clove::
    姜和丁香之类的甜味调料))
verb
（cleave 的过去式）[英]^(past simple of cleave literary or old use)

clump

/klʌmp//klʌmp/
noun
[C]
（尤指树木或花）丛，簇，群[英]^(a group, especially of trees or flowers)
  • ((a clump of grass/daffodils::
    草丛／一簇水仙花))
[C]
硬块，土块[英]^(a solid mass of something such as soil)
  • ((There were big clumps of soil on his boots.::
    他的靴子上有大块大块的泥巴。))
[C usually singular]
沉重缓慢的脚步声[英]^(the loud sound of slow, heavy steps)
  • ((We could hear the clump of his feet on the wooden floor.::
    我们能听到木地板上他那沉重的脚步声。))
verb
[I + adv/prep]
缓慢沉重地行走[英]^(to walk noisily with slow, heavy steps)
  • ((She clumped around the room/up the stairs in her boots.::
    她穿着靴子，在房间里咚咚地走来走去／咚咚地爬上楼梯。))
[I or T]
簇拥;（使）成簇;（使）聚集一丛[英]^(to form a group, or to put things into a group)
  • ((As it started to rain, everyone clumped together in doorways.::
    开始下雨了，大家都聚集在门口。))

clutter

/ˈklʌt.ər//ˈklʌt̬.ɚ/
noun [U]
杂乱，凌乱;杂乱的东西[英]^((a lot of objects in) a state of being untidy)
  • ((Sorry about the clutter in the kitchen.::
    对不起，厨房里杂乱不堪。))
  • ((My desk is covered in/full of clutter.::
    我书桌上堆得乱七八糟。))
verb [T]
塞满，乱堆在;使散乱[英]^(to fill something in an untidy or badly organized way)
  • ((The kids always clutter the hall (up) with school bags and coats and stuff.::
    孩子们总是在厅里乱放书包、外套和乱七八糟的东西。))
  • ((Every shelf is cluttered with ornaments.::
    每层架子上都塞满了装饰品。))
  • ((I try not to clutter (up) my mind with useless information.::
    我尽量不往脑子里装那些无用的东西。))

cobble

/ˈkɒb.əl//ˈkɑː.bəl/ˈkɒb.əl.stəʊn/ˈkɑː.bəl.stoʊn/
noun [C usually plural]
(also cobblestone, /ˈkɒb.əl.stəʊn/ /ˈkɑː.bəl.stoʊn/)
（老式路面用的）鹅卵石[英]^(a rounded stone used on the surface of an old-fashioned road)
  • ((The cart rumbled over the cobbles.::
    大车咕隆隆地碾过鹅卵石。))

cockpit

/ˈkɒk.pɪt//ˈkɑːk.pɪt/
noun [C]
（飞机的）驾驶舱;（赛车的）驾驶座[英]^(the small closed space where the pilot sits in an aircraft, or where the driver sits in a racing car)
驾驶舱[英]^(the area on a boat where the person operating the controls sits or stands)
斗鸡场[英]^(an area where a cockfight is held (= an activity, illegal in many countries, in which people watch as two cocks (= adult male chickens) attack each other and bet money on which one will win))

cocktail

/ˈkɒk.teɪl//ˈkɑːk.teɪl/
noun
[C]
鸡尾酒（通常含酒精）[英]^(a drink, usually an alcoholic one, made by mixing two or more drinks together)
  • ((We were all in the bar sipping cocktails.::
    我们都在酒吧里品着鸡尾酒。))
  • ((a champagne cocktail::
    香槟鸡尾酒))
[C usually singular]
（常指非常规的、危险的或令人兴奋的）混合物[英]^(a mixture of different things, often an unexpected, dangerous, or exciting one)
  • ((The inquest heard that the guitarist died from a cocktail of drink and drugs.::
    尸检发现这个吉他手死于酗酒加吸毒。))
  • ((Cars produce a lethal cocktail of gasses.::
    汽车会产生一种致命的混合气体。))
[C or U]
什锦冷盘[英]^(a cold dish, often eaten at the start of a meal, consisting of small pieces of food)
  • ((fruit cocktail::
    水果拼盘))
  • ((a prawn/seafood cocktail::
    大虾／海鲜冷盘))

coconut

/ˈkəʊ.kə.nʌt//ˈkoʊ.kə.nʌt/
noun
B1 [C]
椰子[英]^(a large fruit like a nut with a thick, hard, brown shell covered in fibre (= a mass of thread-like parts) and containing hard, white flesh that can be eaten and a clear liquid)
  • a coconut shell
B1 [U]
（常用于烹饪的）椰肉[英]^(the white flesh of the coconut, often used in cooking)
  • You can also add coconut to the cookie mix if you like.
  • ((grated/shredded coconut::
    椰蓉／椰丝))

coefficient

/ˌkəʊ.ɪˈfɪʃ.ənt//ˌkoʊ.ɪˈfɪʃ.ənt/
noun [C]
MATHEMATICS
系数[英]^(a value, in mathematics, that appears in front of and multiplies another value)
  • ((In 2x + 4y = 7, 2 is the coefficient of x.::
    在方程2x+4y=7中，2是x的系数。))

coerce

/kəʊˈɜːs//koʊˈɝːs/
verb [T]
强制，强迫；威逼，胁迫[英]^(to persuade someone forcefully to do something that they are unwilling to do)
  • ((The court heard that the six defendants had been coerced into making a confession.::
    法庭在审理中发现6名被告曾受到逼供。))

coffin

/ˈkɒf.ɪn//ˈkɑː.fɪn/
noun [C]
(US also casket)
棺材;灵柩[英]^(a long box in which the body of a dead person is buried or burned)

cohort

/ˈkəʊ.hɔːt//ˈkoʊ.hɔːrt/
noun [C, + sing/pl verb]
SOCIAL SCIENCE
有共同特点（通常指年龄）的一群人[英]^(a group of people who share a characteristic, usually age)
  • ((This study followed up a cohort of 386 patients aged 65+ for six months after their discharge home.::
    这项研究对386位年龄在65岁以上、出院回家的患者进行了6个月的跟踪观察。))
（通常指领袖的）追随者，支持者；党羽[英]^(a group of people who support a particular person, usually a leader)
  • ((The Mayor and his cohorts have abused their positions of power.::
    市长和他的同党们滥用职权。))

communal

/ˈkɒm.jə.nəl/kəˈmjuː.nəl//ˈkɑː.mjə.nəl/kəˈmjuː.nəl/
adjective
公共的;共有的;集体的;公用的[英]^(belonging to or used by a group of people rather than one single person)
  • ((communal facilities/food/property::
    公共设施／共享食品／公有财产))
  • ((We each have a separate bedroom but share a communal kitchen.::
    我们各有一间独立的卧室，但共享一个厨房。))
公社制的[英]^(A communal society is one in which everyone lives and works together and property and possessions are shared rather than being owned by a particular person.)
（较大社会群体内）不同群体之间的[英]^(involving different social or religious groups within a community)
  • ((Communal riots/disturbances have once again broken out between the two ethnic groups.::
    两个种族之间再次爆发了群体骚乱。))
  • ((communal harmony/solidarity::
    群体和谐／团结))

communion

/kəˈmjuː.njən//kəˈmjuː.njən/
noun
[U]
（思想感情的）交流，沟通，交融[英]^(a close relationship with someone in which feelings and thoughts are exchanged)
  • ((He found spiritual communion with her.::
    他觉得和她之间可以进行精神上的交流。))
  • ((He lived in close communion with nature/God.::
    他在生活中与大自然亲密交融／上帝亲密交流。))
[C, + sing/pl verb]
派别;团体;（尤指）教会，教派[英]^(a group of people who are united by the same, especially religious, beliefs)
  • ((The author has a vision of an emerging worldwide Christian communion.::
    作者憧憬会有一个世界性的基督教会出现。))

Communion

complacent

/kəmˈpleɪ.sənt//kəmˈpleɪ.sənt/
adjective
自满的，自鸣得意的[英]^(feeling so satisfied with your own abilities or situation that you feel you do not need to try any harder)
  • ((a complacent smile/attitude::
    自鸣得意的微笑／态度))
  • ((We can't afford to become complacent about any of our products.::
    我们不能对自己的任何一款产品沾沾自喜。))

compost

/ˈkɒm.pɒst//ˈkɑːm.poʊst/
noun [U]
混合肥料;堆肥[英]^(decaying plant material that is added to soil to improve its quality)
verb [T]
把…...制成堆肥[英]^(to collect and store plant material so it can decay and be added to soil to improve its quality)
  • ((Restaurants should compost food waste whenever possible.::
    餐馆应该尽量将厨余制成堆肥。))

con

/kɒn//kɑːn/
verb [T]
-nn-
骗，诈骗，哄骗（通常指钱财）[英]^(to make someone believe something false, usually so that that person will give you their money or possessions)
  • ((She felt she had been conned into buying the car.::
    她觉得自己上当受骗买下了这辆车。))
  • ((Thieves conned him out of his life savings.::
    小偷骗走了他一辈子的积蓄。))
  • ((He managed to con £20 out of them (= get that amount from them by deceiving them).::
    他从他们那里骗得20英镑。))
noun
[C]
骗局;圈套;花招[英]^(a trick to get someone's money or make someone do what you want)
  • ((It's a con - you get half the food for twice the price!::
    这是个圈套——你花两倍的钱才买到一半的食物！))
  • ((a con trick::
    骗局))
[C usually plural]
不利条件；弊病[英]^(a disadvantage or a reason for not doing something)
  • ((One of the cons of buying a bigger car is that it costs more to run.::
    买辆大一点的汽车的缺点是跑起来更费油。))
  • ((You have to weigh up all the pros and cons of the matter before you make a decision.::
    作决定之前，你要权衡问题的利弊。))
[C]
已决犯，既决犯;（服刑中的）囚犯（同 convict）[英]^(short for convict: someone who is in prison because they have been found guilty of a crime)

con-

/kɒn-//kɑːn-/
prefix
共；与同[英]^(together; with)
  • ((conspiracy::
    共谋))
  • ((consortium::
    财团))

Confederate

/kənˈfed.ər.ət//kənˈfed.ɚ.ət/

  • ((The attack helped disorganize the Confederates.::
    这次袭击有助于瓦解邦联。))
  • ((There is a life-size bronze statue of a Confederate outside the museum.::
    博物馆外有一座真人大小的南军铜像。))

  • ((Robert E. Lee was a general in the Confederate army.::
    罗伯特·爱德华·李是南军的一名将军。))
  • ((the Confederate flag::
    邦联旗))

confide

/kənˈfaɪd//kənˈfaɪd/
verb [I or T]
吐露，倾诉（秘密）[英]^(to tell something secret or personal to someone who you trust not to tell anyone else)
  • ((He confided (to her) that his hair was not his own.::
    他（向她）透露他的头发是假发。))
  • (("My husband doesn't know yet, but I'm going to leave him," she confided.::
    “我丈夫还不知道，但我就要离开他了，”她倾诉道。))

  • Online buyers can build their own version of the car: many of the company's customers configure their own vehicles.
  • The marines used specially configured submarines.

confiscate

/ˈkɒn.fɪ.skeɪt//ˈkɑːn.fə.skeɪt/
verb [T]
（通常指作为惩罚）没收，把…充公[英]^(to take a possession away from someone when you have the right to do so, usually as a punishment and often for a limited period, after which it is returned to the owner)
  • ((Miss Edwards confiscated my phone!::
    爱德华小姐没收了我的电话！))
  • ((His passport was confiscated by the police to prevent him from leaving the country.::
    警方没收了他的护照，以防他出境。))

  • ((There is no need for us to congest the city with traffic.::
    我们没有必要让城里的交通变得拥挤。))

noun [U]

  • ((The politics of the newspaper reflect traditional Conservatism.::

  • ((The Tories were out to show that they had shed pre-war Conservatism.::
    保守党出来表明他们已经摆脱了战前的保守主义。))

conserve

verb [T]
/kənˈsɜːv//kənˈsɝːv/
保护；保藏；保存；保留；节约[英]^(to keep and protect something from damage, change, or waste)
  • ((To conserve electricity, we are cutting down on our heating.::
    为了省电，我们在减少中央供热。))
  • ((The nationalists are very eager to conserve their customs and language.::
    民族主义者非常热衷于保留他们的习俗和语言。))
  • ((I'm not being lazy - I'm just conserving my energy/strength for later.::
    我不是在偷懒——我只是在为以后保存精力／体力。))
noun [C or U]
/ˈkɒn.sɜːv//ˈkɑːn.sɝːv/

    他觉得同事们在密谋把他从工作岗位上挤走。))

continuum

/kənˈtɪn.ju.əm//kənˈtɪn.ju.ə//kənˈtɪn.ju.əm//kənˈtɪn.ju.ə/
noun [C]
plural continua continuums
SOCIAL SCIENCE
连续体;渐变体;逐渐演变的事物[英]^(something that changes in character gradually or in very slight stages without any clear dividing points)
  • ((It's not "left-wing or right-wing" - political opinion is a long continuum.::
    这不是“左翼或右翼”的问题——政治观点是长期形成逐渐演变的。))

contour

/ˈkɒn.tɔːr//ˈkɑːn.tʊr/
noun [C]
轮廓;外形;曲线[英]^(the shape of a mass of land or other object, especially its curved surface or the curved shape formed by its outer edge)
  • ((the rugged contour of the coast::
    崎岖不平的海岸线))
  • ((He studied the contours of her face.::
    他仔细端详她的面部轮廓。))
  • ((Her latest collection of swimwear shows off the contours of the human body to perfection.::
    她的最新系列泳装衬完美地托出了人体的曲线。))
GEOGRAPHY
(also contour line)
（地图上的）等高线[英]^(a line on a map that joins points of equal height or depth, in a way that shows high and low areas of land)
  • ((a 400 ft contour line::
    400英尺等高线))
  • ((This map has contours marked at 250-metre intervals.::
    这张地图标有等高距为250米的等高线。))

  • ((A convoy of trucks containing supplies was sent to the famine area.::
    一支满载补给品的车队被派往饥荒严重的地区。))

护卫，护送[英]^(to travel with a vehicle or group of people to make certain that they arrive safely)
  • ((Two tanks convoyed the trucks across the border.::
    两辆坦克护送卡车穿越边境。))

coronary

/ˈkɒr.ən.ər.i//ˈkɔːr.ə.ner.i/
noun [C]
(also coronary thrombosis)
UK
冠状动脉血栓[英]^(an extremely dangerous medical condition in which the flow of blood to the heart is blocked by a blood clot (= a mass of blood))
  • ((He's in hospital after having a coronary last week.::
    上星期他因冠状动脉血栓住进了医院。))
adjective
MEDICAL
动脉的，冠状动脉的[英]^(relating to the arteries (= thick tubes) that supply blood to the muscles of the heart)
  • ((Regular exercise reduces the risk of coronary heart disease.::
    经常锻炼身体能减少患冠心病的危险。))

cosmetics

/kɒzˈmet.ɪk//kɑːzˈmet̬.ɪk/
noun [plural]
我们出售各种各样的化妆品和洗漱用品，价格公道。[英]^(substances that you put on your face or body that are intended to improve your appearance)
  • ((We sell a wide range of cosmetics and toiletries at a very reasonable price.::
    我们出售各种各样的化妆品和洗漱用品，价格公道。))

cosmetic

/kɒzˈmet.ɪk//kɑːzˈmet̬.ɪk/
adjective
装饰门面的，虚饰的，表面的[英]^(Cosmetic changes, etc. are intended to make you believe that something is better when, really, the problem has not been solved.)
  • ((They were offered a few cosmetic improvements to their working conditions, but nothing of significance.::
    表面上他们的工作环境有所改善，但并没有实质上的改变。))
[before noun]
化妆用的，美容的[英]^(used to refer to substances or treatments that are intended to improve your appearance)
  • ((a cosmetic cream::
    美容霜))

coup

/kuː//kuː/
noun [C]
意想不到的成功[英]^(an unexpectedly successful achievement)
  • ((It was a tremendous coup for the local paper to get an exclusive interview with Prince Charles.::
    当地报纸能独家采访到查尔斯王子是破天荒的成功。))
  • ((I got him to come to a party, which was something of a coup.::
    我说服了他来参加聚会，实属意外之得。))
C2
(also coup d'état, uk Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /ˌkuː.deɪˈtɑː/ us Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio /ˌkuː.deɪˈtɑː/ plural coups d'état)
plural coups d'état
政变;（尤指）军事政变[英]^(a sudden illegal, often violent, taking of government power, especially by part of an army)
  • ((a military coup::
    军事政变))

covenant

/ˈkʌv.ən.ənt//ˈkʌv.ən.ənt/
noun [C]
盟约;契约;协定;承诺[英]^(a formal agreement or promise between two or more people)
  • ((The contract contained a restrictive covenant against building on the land.::
    该合同包含严格的限制条款，禁止在这块土地上建筑施工。))
FINANCE & ECONOMICS • UK
（尤指定期向慈善机构捐款的）合同，约定[英]^(a formal agreement to pay a fixed amount of money regularly, especially to a charity)

adjective
/ˈkəʊ.vɜːt//ˈkoʊ.vɝːt/

  • ((covert actions::
    秘密活动))

    该政府被指责秘密组织推翻这一政权的军事行动。))

crackle

/ˈkræk.əl//ˈkræk.əl/
verb [I]
发出尖锐急促声;噼啪作响[英]^(to make a lot of short, dry, sharp sounds)
  • ((The radio started to crackle.::
    收音机开始发出噼里啪啦的声响。))
  • ((The logs crackled and popped in the fireplace.::
    木柴在壁炉里烧得噼啪作响。))
noun [C or U]
尖锐急促的声音;噼啪作响的声音[英]^(a short, dry, sharp sound)
  • ((the crackle of burning logs::
    木柴燃烧的噼啪声))

cram

/kræm//kræm/
verb
-mm-
[T usually + adv/prep]
塞满;塞进;挤入[英]^(to force a lot of things into a small space)
  • ((Eight children were crammed into the back of the car.::
    8个孩子被塞进了汽车的后座。))
  • ((The room was packed and we were crammed against the door.::
    房间里挤得水泄不通，我们被挤靠在门边。))
[T usually + adv/prep]
急匆匆地做（许多事）[英]^(to do many things in a short period of time)
  • ((I had to cram three countries into a week's business trip.::
    我出差一周跑了3个国家。))
[I]
（考试前）死记硬背，突击学习[英]^(to try to learn a lot very quickly before an exam)
  • ((She's cramming for her history exam.::
    为应付历史考试她拼命突击。))

cramp

/kræmp//kræmp/
noun [C or U]
痉挛，抽筋（常出现在大量运动后）[英]^(a sudden painful tightening in a muscle, often after a lot of exercise, that limits movement)
  • ((Several runners needed treatment for cramp (US cramps) and exhaustion.::
    有几个跑步者因为抽筋和体力衰竭需要治疗。))
  • ((I've got cramp in my foot.::
    我的脚抽筋了。))
  • ((stomach cramps::
    胃痉挛))
verb [T]
限制，束缚；阻碍，妨碍[英]^(to limit someone, especially to prevent them from enjoying a full life)
  • ((Worry and lack of money cramp the lives of the unemployed.::
    焦虑和缺钱束缚着失业者的生活。))

cramps

/kræmp//kræmp/
noun [plural]
pains in the lower stomach caused by a woman's period
  • She took some medicine for her cramps.

  • ((a milk crate::

    一箱空瓶子))

  • ((Do you crate her at night?::
    你晚上把它放进笼子里吗？))

crater

/ˈkreɪ.tər//ˈkreɪ.t̬ɚ/

  • ((the huge crater of Vesuvius::

    炸弹坑))
  • ((With a good telescope, you can see craters on the moon.::
    用好的望远镜能看到月亮上的环形山。))

creak

/kriːk//kriːk/
verb [I]
（门、地板等）嘎吱作响[英]^(When a door, floorboard, etc. creaks, it makes a long low sound when it moves or is moved.)
  • ((The door creaked on its hinges.::
    门打开时合页处嘎吱作响。))
  • ((I heard the floorboards creak as he crept closer.::
    他蹑手蹑脚走近时我听见地板嘎吱嘎吱地响。))
noun [C]
嘎吱声[英]^(a noise made when something creaks)
  • ((I heard a creak on the stairs.::
    我听见楼梯上嘎吱一声响。))

crease

/kriːs//kriːs/
noun
[C]

  • ((He ironed a crease down the front of each trouser leg.::
    他在每条裤腿的正面熨出一条褶痕来。))
[S] • SPORTS
（板球击球手击球的）区域线，击球线[英]^(a line drawn on the ground where the player stands to hit the ball in cricket)
verb [I or T]
(also wrinkle)
UK
压皱；（使）起褶皱[英]^(If cloth, paper, etc. creases, or if you crease it, it gets a line in it where it has been folded or crushed.)
  • ((The seat belt has creased my blouse.::
    安全带把我的衬衫弄皱了。))
  • ((It's a nice dress, but it creases very easily.::
    这条裙子很漂亮，但很容易起皱。))

  • ((They haven't produced any credible evidence for convicting him.::

  • I'm going to sail to the mouth of the Thames and then let the tide take me up a creek.
  • She loved the Suffolk coast,with its creeks and marshes and reed beds under a huge sky.

(US also crick)

  • That night they set up camp near the creek.

  • ((a royal crest::

  • ((Waist circumference was measured midway between the lower rib margin and the iliac crest.::
    腰围是测量最下面一块肋骨和髂骨嵴之间的中间点一圈的长度。))

  • ((I'm a bit crook at the moment.::
    我目前身体不太好。))

  • ((She delicately crooked her little finger as she picked up her cup.::
    她端茶杯时优雅地翘起小指。))

    她紧张地在指间捻着面包。))

    上面建有房屋的悬崖开始倾颓瓦解。))

    对政府的支持日渐减少。))

  • ((This shirt crumples easily::
    这件衬衫很容易起皱。))

  • ((Her face crumpled with laughter.::
    她笑得脸上尽是皱纹。))

  • ((The bullet hit him and he crumpled into a heap on the floor.::

crunch

verb [I or T]
/krʌntʃ//krʌntʃ/
嘎吱地咬嚼;嘎吱作响[英]^(to crush hard food loudly between the teeth, or to make a sound as if something is being crushed or broken)
  • ((She was crunching noisily on an apple.::
    她嘎吱嘎吱地嚼着苹果。))
  • ((The gravel crunched underfoot as we walked up to the house.::
    我们向房子走去，脚下的砾石嚓嚓作响。))
noun
/krʌntʃ//krʌntʃ/
[C usually singular]
嘎吱的声音[英]^(the sound of hard food being crushed between the teeth, or like something being crushed or broken)
  • ((The woods were silent apart from the crunch of our feet in the snow.::
    树林里一片寂静，只有我们踩在雪地上的嘎吱嘎吱声。))
[C usually plural]
增强腹肌的锻炼;仰卧起坐[英]^(an exercise in which you lie on your back on the floor with your knees bent and your feet flat on the floor, and then raise your head and shoulders)
  • ((Doing crunches every day strengthens your abdominal muscles.::
    每天练习仰卧起坐可以增强腹部肌肉。))

the crunch

/krʌntʃ//krʌntʃ/
noun [S]
严峻的形势；紧要关头；需要作出艰难抉择的时刻[英]^(a difficult situation that forces you to make a decision or do something)
  • ((The crunch came when she was forced to choose between her marriage and her career.::
    关键时刻到了，她不得不在婚姻和事业之间作出选择。))

noun
[C]

  • ((They have long been involved in a crusade for racial equality.::
    他们长期以来一直致力于争取种族平等的运动。))
  • ((a moral crusade against drugs::
    反毒品的正义运动))
[C often plural]
(also Crusade)
十字军东征[英]^(one of the religious wars (= crusades) fought by Christians, mostly against Muslims in Palestine, in the 11th, 12th, 13th, and 17th centuries)

  • ((She crusaded against sex and violence on television.::
    她致力于反对电视节目中的色情和暴力。))

[C]

    他们的儿子离家出走，加入了一个邪教组织。))

风行;流行;崇拜[英]^(someone or something that has become very popular with a particular group of people)
  • ((the cult of celebrity::
    名人崇拜))

  • ((The singer had a cult following in the 1970s.::
    这位歌手在20世纪70年代拥有一批狂热的追随者。))
  • ((a cult figure/movie::
    偶像人物／风靡一时的影片))

    他总是想方设法拍老板马屁。))

  • ((to curtail your holiday/spending::
    缩短假期／缩减开支))
  • ((With all the snow, our daily walks have been severely curtailed.::
    雪太多，我们每天的散步被大大削减。))

cynical

/ˈsɪn.ɪ.kəl//ˈsɪn.ɪ.kəl/
adjective
C2
愤世嫉俗的;怀疑人之真诚的;认为人皆自私的[英]^(believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere)
  • ((She has a pretty cynical view of men.::
    她对男人的态度太过偏激。))
  • ((I've always been deeply cynical about politicians.::
    我对政客们总是嗤之以鼻。))
利用他人感情的；损人利己的[英]^(used to say that someone's feelings or emotions are used to your own advantage)
  • ((She works in that most cynical of industries - advertising.::
    她供职于最具煽惑性的行业——广告行业。))
  • ((He praises my cooking but it's just a cynical ploy to get me to make him dinner.::
    他夸我烧一手好菜只不过是在耍花招，哄我给他做饭。))

dale

/deɪl//deɪl/
noun [C]
Northern English
峡谷，山谷[英]^(a valley)

the (Yorkshire) Dales

/deɪl//deɪl/
noun [C]
an area of northern England in which there are a lot of hills and valleys
  • We're going walking in the Yorkshire Dales this summer.

dangle

/ˈdæŋ.ɡəl//ˈdæŋ.ɡəl/
verb
[I or T]
（使）垂下；（使）悬荡；悬挂；提着来回摆动[英]^(to hang loosely, or to hold something so that it hangs loosely)
  • ((Loose electric wires were dangling from the wall.::
    松散的电线从墙上垂了下来。))
  • ((He dangled the puppet in front of the children.::
    他在孩子们面前耍木偶。))
[T]
（为了说服某人去做某事而）用…作为许诺，答应用…作为回报[英]^(to offer someone something that they want in order to persuade that person to do something)
  • ((I've tried dangling all kinds of offers in front of him to get him to work harder at school, but nothing works.::
    为了让他学习用心点儿，我曾试过种种许诺，可是根本不起任何作用。))

dart

/dɑːt//dɑːrt/
noun
[C]
镖，飞镖[英]^(a small, thin object with a sharp point that is thrown by hand in a game, shot from a gun, or blown from a tube when used as a weapon)
[C]
（为使衣料更合身缝出的）褶，皱褶[英]^(a small fold, becoming narrower towards one end, that is sewn into a piece of clothing to make it fit better)
[C usually singular]
飞快突然的动作[英]^(a quick, sudden movement)
  • ((We made a dart for (= moved quickly towards) the exit.::
    我们朝出口冲去。))
verb [I + adv/prep]
飞奔，猛冲[英]^(to move quickly or suddenly)
  • ((I darted behind the sofa and hid.::
    我冲到沙发后藏了起来。))

darts

/dɑːt//dɑːrt/
noun [U]
一场掷镖游戏[英]^(a game in which darts are thrown at a circular board. The number of points won depends on where the darts land on the board)
  • ((a game of darts::
    一场掷镖游戏))

dart a glance/look at someone/something

/dɑːt//dɑːrt/
verb [I + adv/prep]
(also dart a glance/look somewhere)
她狠狠地瞪了我一眼。[英]^(to look quickly at someone or something, or to look quickly somewhere)
  • ((She darted an angry look at me.::
    她狠狠地瞪了我一眼。))

daunt

/dɔːnt//dɑːnt/
verb [T often passive]
使吓倒；使气馁[英]^(to make someone feel slightly frightened or worried about their ability to achieve something)
  • ((She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem.::
    她丝毫也没有被问题的严重性吓住。))

deacon

/ˈdiː.kən//ˈdiː.kən/
noun [C]
UK
（某些宗教团体的）执事，会吏[英]^(in some churches, an official, either male or female, who is below a priest in rank and who performs some of the duties of a priest)
US
（某些宗教团体由非神职人员担任的）辅祭；助祭[英]^(in some churches, a lay person (= an ordinary person without religious training) who helps with the running and organization of the church)

debris

/ˈdeb.riː/ˈdeɪ.briː//dəˈbriː/
noun [U]
碎片，残片[英]^(broken or torn pieces of something larger)
  • ((Debris from the aircraft was scattered over a large area.::
    飞机残片散落在一片很大的区域。))

deceased

/dɪˈsiːst//dɪˈsiːst/

C2
