trek

/trek//trek/
verb [I usually + adv/prep]
-kk-
（徒步）长途跋涉，翻山越岭[英]^(to walk a long distance, usually over land such as hills, mountains, or forests)
  • ((We spent the day trekking through forests and over mountains.::
    白天我们穿过丛林，翻山越岭。))
  • ((I trekked (= walked a long and tiring distance) all the way into town to meet him and he didn't even turn up.::
    我大老远好不容易进城来看他，他却连面都不露一下。))
noun [C]
C1
（徒步）长途跋涉，翻山越岭[英]^(a long walk over land such as hills, mountains, or forests)
  • ((We did an eight-hour trek yesterday.::
    昨天我们走了8个小时。))
（令人精疲力尽的）艰苦行程[英]^(a walk that is long and difficult or makes you feel very tired)
  • ((You can walk to town from here, but it's quite a trek.::
    你可以从这儿走到城里去，但是路有些远。))

tribunal

/traɪˈbjuː.nəl//traɪˈbjuː.nəl/
noun [C]
（尤指由政府正式选定的）特别法庭，审理委员会[英]^(a special court or group of people who are officially chosen, especially by the government, to examine (legal) problems of a particular type)
  • ((a war crimes tribunal::
    战争犯罪特别法庭))
  • ((She took her case to an immigration appeals tribunal.::
    她向移民上诉法庭提出了申诉。))

tribune

/ˈtrɪb.juːn//ˈtrɪb.juːn/
noun [C]
（用于报纸名字）论坛[英]^(used in the titles of some newspapers)
  • ((The New York Tribune::
    《纽约论坛报》))
（古罗马）护民官[英]^(in ancient Rome, an elected official whose job was to protect people's rights)

trickle down, from, out of, etc. something

/ˈtrɪk.əl//ˈtrɪk.əl/
verb [I]
从…向下滴（或淌）[英]^(If liquid trickles somewhere, it flows slowly and without force in a thin line.)
  • ((Blood trickled out of the corner of his mouth.::
    血从他的嘴角滴了下来。))
  • ((Oil was trickling from a tiny hole in the tank.::
    油正从油罐上的一个小孔往下滴。))

trickle in, out, back, etc.

/ˈtrɪk.əl//ˈtrɪk.əl/
verb [I]
缓慢而零星地进入／离开／返回（等等）[英]^(to arrive or move somewhere slowly and gradually, in small numbers)
  • ((Gradually people trickled back into the theatre for the second half.::
    渐渐地，人们开始三三两两地回到剧院看下半场。))

trickle

/ˈtrɪk.əl//ˈtrɪk.əl/
noun
[S]
三三两两，零星[英]^(a very small number of people or things arriving or leaving somewhere)
  • ((We usually only get a trickle of customers in the mornings.::
    早上我们店里通常只有零星的顾客。))
[C]
从…向下滴（或淌）[英]^(a small amount of liquid that is flowing slowly in a thin line)
  • ((A trickle of melted butter made its way down his chin.::
    一滴融化了的黄油顺着他的下巴向下滑。))

trinity

/ˈtrɪn.ə.ti//ˈtrɪn.ə.t̬i/
noun [C usually singular]
三件套;三人一组;三合一[英]^(a group of three things or people)
  • ((Modern culture now appears to revolve around the unholy trinity of sport, shopping, and sex.::
    当代文化现在似乎是以体育、购物和性这三样世俗活动为中心。))
  • ((Above all Amenabar worships the trinity of Hitchcock, Kubrick, and Spielberg.::
    阿梅纳瓦尔尤其崇拜希区柯克、库布里克和斯皮尔伯格这三位。))

the Trinity

/ˈtrɪn.ə.ti//ˈtrɪn.ə.t̬i/
noun [S]
(also the Holy Trinity)
（基督教中的）三位一体（指圣父、圣子和圣灵合为上帝）[英]^(in Christianity, the existence of one God in three forms, the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit)

trio

/ˈtriː.əʊ//ˈtriː.oʊ/
noun
plural trios
C2 [C, + sing/pl verb]
三人一组;三件套;三合一[英]^(a group of three people or things)
  • ((There was disappointment for the trio of 200 metre runners, all of whom failed to reach the final.::
    我们参加200米跑的3位选手都很令人失望，没有一个人进入决赛。))
[C, + sing/pl verb]
三重奏;三重唱[英]^(a group of three musicians or singers who perform together)
  • ((Many jazz trios consist of piano, guitar, and double bass.::
    许多爵士三重奏均由钢琴、吉他和低音提琴组成。))
[C]
三重奏曲;三重唱曲[英]^(a piece of music that has been written to be performed by three people)
  • ((The final item on today's programme is Beethoven's Trio in B flat.::
    今天的最后一个曲目是贝多芬的三重奏曲，降B调。))

trophy

/ˈtrəʊ.fi//ˈtroʊ.fi/
noun [C]
B2
奖，（流动）奖杯[英]^(a prize, such as a gold or silver cup, that is given to the winner of a competition or race, and often returned after a year to be given to the winner of the competition in the following year)
  • ((He's an excellent rider, but he's never won a major trophy.::
    他是个出色的骑手，但从未赢得过任何一项重要比赛的冠军。))
  • ((The Duchess of Cambridge will be presenting the trophies.::
    剑桥公爵夫人将颁奖。))
战利品;猎获物;胜利纪念品[英]^(something used as a symbol of success from hunting or war)
  • ((The animal heads on the wall were trophies of his hunting trips.::
    墙上的动物头是他打猎的战利品。))

tropic

/ˈtrɒp.ɪk//ˈtrɑː.pɪk/
noun [C]
GEOGRAPHY • ENVIRONMENT
回归线[英]^(one of the two imaginary lines around the earth at approximately 23.5 degrees north and 23.5 degrees south of the equator)

the tropics

/ˈtrɒp.ɪk//ˈtrɑː.pɪk/
noun [plural]
GEOGRAPHY • ENVIRONMENT
热带地区[英]^(the hottest area of the earth, between the Tropic of Cancer and the Tropic of Capricorn)
  • ((She's a botanist and spent several years doing research in the tropics.::
    她是个植物学家，花了几年时间在热带地区做研究。))

trot

verb
/trɒt//trɑːt/
-tt-
[I usually + adv/prep]
（四肢动物的）小跑，慢跑[英]^(If a horse or similar animal with four legs trots, it runs at its slowest speed, using short steps in which a front leg and the back leg on the opposite side move together.)
  • ((She was trotting along on her pony.::
    她正骑着马驹小跑着。))
  • ((The dog trotted down the path to greet me.::
    这只狗沿路小跑着过来迎接我。))
[I usually + adv/prep]
（人）匆忙地走，快步走[英]^(When people trot somewhere, they go there in a quick or busy way.)
  • ((She came trotting down the street after me.::
    她跟在我身后沿着街道小跑着。))
[I + adv/prep] UK
连珠炮似地说;急匆匆地做[英]^(to speak or do something too quickly)
  • ((She was rather nervous and trotted through her speech a bit too quickly.::
    她比较紧张，演讲速度有点偏快。))
noun [S]
/trɒt//trɑːt/
（马或类似动物的）快步，小跑[英]^(the speed or movement of a horse or similar animal when it trots)
  • ((He climbed onto his horse and headed off at a relaxed trot.::
    他骑上马，轻快地小跑着出发了。))
（人的）慢跑，小步跑[英]^(a slow run by a human)
  • ((The team warmed up for the match with a trot around the pitch.::
    队员们绕着球场慢跑为比赛热身。))

the trots

/trɒt//trɑːt/
noun [plural]
腹泻[英]^(diarrhoea (= a condition in which the contents of the bowels are emptied too often))
  • ((to get/have the trots::
    拉肚子))
  • ((That takeaway gave me the trots.::
    那份外卖吃得我拉肚子。))

trout

/traʊt//traʊt/
noun
[C or U]
plural trout trouts
鳟鱼[英]^(a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food)
  • ((Thousands of young salmon and trout have been killed by pollution.::
    成千上万条鲑鱼和鳟鱼的幼鱼因污染而死亡。))
  • ((The lake is famous for its trout fishing.::
    这座湖以捕鲑鱼闻名。))
[U]
鳟鱼肉[英]^(the flesh of this fish eaten as food)
  • ((I had some perfectly cooked trout.::
    我吃的是一份做得极好的鳟鱼。))
[C] UK
plural trouts
老家伙；（尤指）讨厌的婆娘，恶婆子[英]^(an old person, especially a woman, who is unpleasant or not attractive)
  • ((She's a miserable old trout who complains about everything.::
    她是个令人讨厌、牢骚满腹的老太婆。))

trump

noun [C]
/trʌmp//trʌmp/
（牌戏中的一张）王牌，将牌[英]^(a card that belongs to the group of cards that has been chosen to have the highest value in a particular game)
  • ((I played a trump.::
    我打了一张王牌。))
  • ((Luckily, I drew a trump.::
    我幸运地抽到了一张王牌。))
verb [T]
/trʌmp//trʌmp/
（牌戏中）打出王牌赢（别人的牌）[英]^(If you trump another player's card, you beat it with a card that belongs to the group of cards that has been chosen to have the highest value in the game you are playing.)
打败，赢[英]^(to beat someone or something by doing or producing something better)
  • ((Their $60 million bid for the company was trumped at the last moment by an offer for almost twice as much from their main competitor.::
    他们出价6000万美元收购那家公司，但最终输给了以几乎两倍价格竞标的主要对手。))

trumps

/trʌmp//trʌmp/
noun [plural]
王牌花色，主牌花色[英]^(one of the four groups in a set of playing cards that has been chosen to have the highest value during a particular game or part of a game)
  • ((Diamonds are trumps.::
    方块是王牌。))

no trump(s)

/trʌmp//trʌmp/
noun
（桥牌戏中）无王牌，无主牌[英]^(a situation in which all four groups of cards have equal value in a game of bridge)

/zɑːr//zɑːr/
noun [C]
(also tzar); (US usually czar)
UK
（1917年以前俄国的）沙皇[英]^((until 1917) the male Russian ruler)
  • ((Tsar Nicholas I::
    沙皇尼古拉一世))
UK
特派官员[英]^(a person who has been given special powers by the government to deal with a particular matter)
  • ((The government has appointed a drugs tsar to coordinate the fight against drug abuse.::
    政府任命了一位缉毒特派员来协调禁毒战。))
UK
（商界或政界的）要人[英]^(a powerful person in business or politics)
  • ((a group of publishing tsars::
    一群出版界要人))

turbulence

/ˈtɜː.bjə.ləns//ˈtɝː.bjə.ləns/
noun [U]
骚乱，骚动;动荡，混乱[英]^(a state of confusion without any order)
  • ((The era was characterized by political and cultural turbulence.::
    在那个时代里，政治和文化都动荡不安。))
  • ((There are signs of turbulence ahead for the economy.::
    有迹象显示经济不久将要出现动荡。))
（气体或水形成的）紊流，湍流[英]^(strong sudden movements within air or water)
  • ((We might be experiencing some turbulence on this flight due to an approaching electrical storm.::
    由于前面有雷暴向我们袭来，我们的飞机可能会遇到不稳定气流。))

turf

/tɜːf//tɝːf/
noun
[C or U]
plural turfs UK turves
草皮;草皮块[英]^(the surface layer of land on which grass is growing, consisting of the grass and the soil in which its roots grow, or a piece of this that is cut from the ground and is usually rectangular)
[U]
（某人的）专门领域[英]^(a subject in which a person or group has a lot of knowledge or influence)
  • ((Antiques are very much her turf.::
    对古玩她很在行。))
[U]
地盘，势力范围[英]^(the area that a group considers its own)
  • ((Judges feel that the courtroom is their private turf.::
    法官觉得法庭属于他们的私人领地。))
  • ((The gymnastics team won the championship on their home turf.::
    该体操队在自己的主场获得了冠军。))
verb [T]
用草皮覆盖[英]^(to cover a piece of land with turf)

the turf

/tɜːf//tɝːf/
noun [S]

turtle

/ˈtɜː.təl//ˈtɝː.t̬əl/
noun [C]
(also sea turtle)
plural turtles turtle
龟;海龟[英]^(a reptile that lives in the sea and has a thick shell covering its body into which it can move its head and legs for protection. Turtles come onto land in order to lay their eggs.)
  • Thousands of turtles emerged from the waves and crawled across the sand on unsteady flippers.
  • The world's population of sea turtles has now become dangerously small.

twilight

/ˈtwaɪ.laɪt//ˈtwaɪ.laɪt/
noun [U]
黄昏时分，薄暮时分[英]^(the period just before it becomes completely dark in the evening)
  • ((I could make out a dark figure in the twilight.::
    暮色中我能辨认出一个黑影。))
adjective
（生活）处于社会边缘的，不安稳的[英]^(used to describe a way of life that involves illegal or immoral activities, and is on the edge of normal society)
  • ((The remaining inhabitants of this once-prosperous town have got used to a twilight existence.::
    这个曾经繁华的商业重镇里遗留下的居民已经习惯了动荡不安的生活。))
  • ((Leaving a secure job for the twilight world of pop music may have been a mistake.::
    抛弃安稳的工作进入充满未知的流行音乐界也许是个错误。))

the twilight of something

/ˈtwaɪ.laɪt//ˈtwaɪ.laɪt/
noun
晚期[英]^(the final part of a period)
  • ((I knew him when he was in the twilight of his career.::
    我在他职业生涯的晚期才认识他。))

twine

/twaɪn//twaɪn/
verb [I or T, usually + adv/prep]
（使）缠绕，（使）盘绕[英]^(to (cause to) wrap round an object several times)
  • ((The vine twines around/up the pole.::
    藤蔓攀绕着柱子向上长。))
  • ((Twine the different coloured threads together.::
    把不同颜色的线编在一起。))
noun [U]
（两股或多股的）线，细绳，麻绳[英]^(strong string made of two or more pieces of string twisted together)
  • ((a ball of twine::
    线球))
  • ((garden twine::
    花园攀援茎))

twitch

/twɪtʃ//twɪtʃ/
verb
[I or T]
（使）抽搐;（使）抽动;（使）颤动[英]^((to cause) to make a sudden small movement with a part of the body, usually without intending to)
  • ((He tried to suppress a smile but felt the corner of his mouth twitch.::
    他试图忍住笑，但感到嘴角在抽动。))
  • ((She twitched her nose like a rabbit.::
    她像兔子一样抽动了一下鼻子。))
[T]
急拉;轻拉;拉扯[英]^(to give something a sudden light pull)
  • ((You'll feel something twitch the line when you get a fish.::
    鱼上钩时，你会感到有东西在轻轻拉钓鱼线。))
noun [C]
抽搐;抽动;颤动[英]^(a sudden small, usually unintentional, movement of a part of the body)
  • ((I have a twitch in the corner of my eye.::
    我的眼角在跳。))
急拉;轻拉;拉扯[英]^(a sudden light pull or movement)

twofold

/ˈtuː.fəʊld//ˈtuː.foʊld/
adjective
两倍的[英]^(twice as big or as much)
  • ((a twofold increase in the price of natural gas::
    天然气的价格上涨了两倍。))
有两部分的[英]^(having two parts)
  • ((The problem is twofold.::
    问题有两方面。))
adverb
（以）两倍（地）[英]^(by two times)
  • ((The sport saw its popularity increase twofold.::
    这项体育的受欢迎程度上升了两倍。))

type

/taɪp//taɪp/
noun
A2 [C]
类型；种类；品种[英]^(a particular group of people or things that share similar characteristics and form a smaller division of a larger set)
  • ((There were so many different types of bread that I didn't know which to buy.::
    面包种类繁多，我不知该买哪一种。))
  • ((What type of clothes does she wear?::
    她穿什么类型的衣服？))
  • ((It was dark so I didn't notice what type of car it was.::
    天太黑，我没有注意到是什么车型。))
  • ((He's the type of man you could take home to your mother.::
    他是那种你可以带回家见母亲的男人。))
  • ((He's very attractive, if you like the blond, athletic type.::
    假如你喜欢白肤金发、爱好运动那一类型的话，他算是很有魅力的。))
  • ((They sell dried flowers and baskets and that type of thing.::
    他们卖干花、花篮之类的东西。))
  • ((We have a range of moisturizers for all different skin types.::
    我们有一系列适合各种肤质的润肤品。))
  • ((She was young and she was wearing student-type clothes, so I assumed she was studying here.::
    她年龄不大，穿得又像学生，所以我还以为她在这儿上学。))
  • ((He took me to a bar full of actor types trying to get noticed.::
    他带我去了一个酒吧，那里到处是演员一类的人，希望能引起他们的注意。))
C1 [C] • LITERATURE
具代表性的人;典型[英]^(a person who seems to represent a particular group of people, having all the qualities that you usually connect with that group)
  • ((He doesn't use fully rounded characters in his plays - he uses types.::
    他在剧中不用个性丰满的人物——他用的是类型化的人物。))
[C or U] • PUBLISHING
(also typeface)
打印字体;印刷字体[英]^(the style and size of printed letters used in a piece of printed writing such as in a newspaper, book, or article)
  • ((Use bold type for your headings.::
    标题用黑体字。))
  • ((The software allows you to choose from over 20 styles of typeface.::
    用这种软件有20多种字体可选择。))
verb [I or T]
B1
（用电脑键盘或打字机等）打字[英]^(to write using a machine, either a computer keyboard or a typewriter)
  • ((She asked me to type a couple of letters.::
    她叫我打几封信。))
  • ((He can type very quickly.::
    他打字很快。))
  • ((I was typing away into the early hours of the morning just to get it done.::
    我打字打到凌晨，就为把事情做完。))

be someone's type

/taɪp//taɪp/
noun
C2
是（某人）喜欢的那种类型[英]^(to be the type of person that someone thinks is attractive)
  • ((He's a nice enough guy - he's just not my type.::
    他人倒是挺好，只是不是我喜欢的那种类型。))
  • ((I would have thought Ben was more your type.::
    我还以为你会更喜欢本这种类型的人。))

    他还在用一部旧打字机。))

umpire

/ˈʌm.paɪər//ˈʌm.paɪr/
noun [C]

  • ((a cricket/tennis umpire::
    板球／网球裁判))
  • The umpire overruled the linesman and ordered the point to be replayed.

underpin

/ˌʌn.dəˈpɪn//ˌʌn.dɚˈpɪn/
verb [T]
-nn-
ARCHITECTURE
支撑;加强;巩固;构成（基础）[英]^(to give support, strength, or a basic structure to something)
  • ((He presented data to underpin his argument.::
    他提供了一些数据来支持他的论点。))
  • ((Gradually the laws that underpinned (= formed part of the basic structure of) apartheid were abolished.::
    以种族隔离制度为基础的法律被逐步废除了。))
  • ((When restoring the building, the first priority was to underpin the exterior walls by adding wooden supports along the foundations.::
    修复这座建筑物时，首先要做的是沿着地基给外墙增加木支撑。))

understate

/ˌʌn.dəˈsteɪt//ˌʌn.dɚˈsteɪt/
verb [T]
对…轻描淡写;不如实陈述;避重就轻地说[英]^(to describe something in a way that makes it seem less important, serious, bad, etc. than it really is)
  • ((She believes the research understates the amount of discrimination women suffer.::
    她认为该研究对妇女所遭受的歧视轻描淡写。))

underway

/ˌʌn.dəˈweɪ//ˌʌn.dɚˈweɪ/
adjective [after verb]
(also under way)
C2
正在进行的；正在发生的[英]^(If something is underway, it is happening now.)
  • ((Economic recovery is already underway.::
    经济已开始复苏了。))

get underway

/ˌʌn.dəˈweɪ//ˌʌn.dɚˈweɪ/
adjective [after verb]
(also under way)
C2
开始[英]^(to begin)
  • ((The film festival gets underway on 11 July .::
    电影节于7月11日开幕。))

underwrite

/ˌʌn.dərˈaɪt//ˈʌn.dɚ.raɪt/
verb [T]
underwrote | underwritten
（银行或其他机构）为…提供财力支持并承担经济责任[英]^(If a bank or other organization underwrites an activity, it gives it financial support and takes responsibility for paying any costs if it fails.)
FINANCE & ECONOMICS
为…承担保险责任，为…承保[英]^(If a company underwrites an insurance policy, someone's property, etc., that company has an agreement to pay out money in cases of damage or loss.)

unilateral

/ˌjuː.nɪˈlæt.ər.əl//ˌjuː.nəˈlæt̬.ɚ.əl/
adjective
单边的;单方的[英]^(involving only one group or country)
  • ((The party leader has actually declared her support for unilateral nuclear disarmament (= giving up her country's nuclear weapons without first waiting for other countries to do the same).::
    该党领导人实际上已经宣布了她支持单方面核裁军的决定。))

unison

/ˈjuː.nɪ.sən//ˈjuː.nə.sən/
noun [U or C]
齐唱，齐奏[英]^(the playing or singing of notes at the same pitch by different instruments or voices)
  • ((unison singing::
    齐唱))
  • ((Here the tenors are in unison with the basses.::
    此处男高音与男低音齐唱。))

in unison

/ˈjuː.nɪ.sən//ˈjuː.nə.sən/
noun
共同；一致；一齐[英]^(acting or speaking together, or at the same time)
  • (("We want ice cream!" the children chanted in unison.::
    “我们要吃冰激凌！”孩子们齐声不断喊道。))

unravel

/ʌnˈræv.əl//ʌnˈræv.əl/
verb
-ll- US usually -l-
[I or T]
（把布、结或线团）解开;拆散[英]^(If a piece of knitted or woven cloth, a knot, or a mass of thread unravels, it separates into a single thread, and if you unravel it, you separate it into a single thread.)
  • ((You'd better mend that hole before the whole sweater starts to unravel.::
    你最好把那个洞补上，免得整件毛衣脱线。))
  • ((I had to unravel one of the sleeves because I realized I'd knitted it too small.::
    我不得不拆掉一只袖子，因为我发现它织得太小了。))
[I or T]
揭开，弄清，阐明（谜团或复杂问题）;被澄清;被解决[英]^(If you unravel a mysterious, unknown, or complicated subject, you make it known or understood, and if it unravels, it becomes known or understood.)
  • ((We have a long way to go before we unravel the secrets of genetics.::
    在揭开遗传学之谜前，我们还有很长的路要走。))
[I, T usually passive]
破坏（成就等）[英]^(If a process or achievement that was slow and complicated unravels or is unravelled, it is destroyed.)
  • ((As talks between the leaders broke down, several months of careful diplomacy were unravelled.::
    由于领导人之间的会谈破裂，几个月精心策划的外交努力付诸东流。))

unsettling

/ʌnˈset.əl.ɪŋ//ʌnˈset̬.əl.ɪŋ/
adjective
造成动荡的；扰乱的[英]^(causing change)
令人不安的，使人担忧的[英]^(causing worry or anxiety)
  • ((One of the documentary's many unsettling images is of a child playing with her father's gun.::
    纪录片中最令人不安的镜头之一是一个小孩在摆弄父亲的枪。))

upheaval

/ʌpˈhiː.vəl//ʌpˈhiː.vəl/
noun [C or U]
激变;动荡;剧变[英]^(a great change, especially causing or involving much difficulty, activity, or trouble)
  • ((Yesterday's coup brought further upheaval to a country already struggling with famine.::
    昨天的军事政变使这个正在饥荒中挣扎的国家更加动荡不安。))
  • ((I'm not sure it's worth the upheaval of moving to gain just a little more space.::
    我怀疑费这么大力气搬家就为了得到多一点空间是不是值得。))

uprising

/ˈʌpˌraɪ.zɪŋ//ˈʌpˌraɪ.zɪŋ/
noun [C]
(also rising)
起义;暴动[英]^(an act of opposition, sometimes using violence, by many people in one area of a country against those who are in power)
  • ((Following a determined resistance in the east, there was eventually a popular uprising in the capital.::
    在东部发生坚决的抵抗运动后，最终在首都爆发了人民起义。))

uranium

/jʊəˈreɪ.ni.əm//jʊˈreɪ.ni.əm/
noun [U]
(symbol U)
铀[英]^(a chemical element that is a heavy, radioactive metal, used in the production of nuclear power and in some types of nuclear weapon)

urine

/ˈjʊə.rɪn//ˈjʊr.ɪn/
noun [U]
尿液，小便[英]^(the yellowish liquid waste that is released from the body when you urinate)

usher

/ˈʌʃ.ər//ˈʌʃ.ɚ/
verb [T usually + adv/prep]
引导;引领;把…引往[英]^(to show someone where they should go, or to make someone go where you want them to go)
  • ((She ushered us into her office and offered us coffee.::
    她把我们领进她的办公室，给我们倒了咖啡。))
  • ((Officials quickly ushered the protesters out of the hall.::
    官员们很快就把抗议者送出了大厅。))
noun [C]
（尤指婚礼等正式场合或剧院、电影院的）引座员[英]^(a man who shows people where they should sit, especially at a formal event such as a wedding or at a theatre or cinema)

vaccinate

/ˈvæk.sɪ.neɪt//ˈvæk.sə.neɪt/
verb [T]
C2
给…接种疫苗[英]^(to give someone a vaccine, usually by injection, to prevent them from getting a disease)
  • ((The children were vaccinated against the major childhood diseases.::
    孩子们接种了预防主要儿童疾病的疫苗。))

vagina

/vəˈdʒaɪ.nə//vəˈdʒaɪ.nə/
noun [C]
阴道[英]^(the part of a woman or other female mammal's body that connects her outer sex organs to her uterus)
ANATOMY
（身体结构）鞘[英]^(a structure in the body that is shaped like a long close-fitting covering)

vandal

/ˈvæn.dəl//ˈvæn.dəl/
noun [C]
故意破坏他人财产者[英]^(a person who intentionally damages property belonging to other people)
  • ((Vandals smashed windows and overturned cars in the downtown shopping district.::
    捣乱分子在市中心的商业区砸烂窗户并掀翻汽车。))

vault

/vɒlt//vɑːlt/
noun [C]
（尤指教堂或公共建筑的）拱顶，穹顶[英]^(a type of arch that supports a roof or ceiling, especially in a church or public building, or a ceiling or roof supported by several of these arches)
(UK also vaults)
（尤指银行的）金库，保险库[英]^(a room, especially in a bank, with thick walls and a strong door, used to store money or valuable things in safe conditions)
  • ((a bank vault::
    银行金库))
  • ((She entered the vault with an armed guard.::
    她同一名武装保安一起进入了金库。))
（教堂的）地下墓室;（墓地的）墓穴[英]^(a room under a church or a small building in a cemetery where dead bodies are buried)
  • ((She was buried in the family vault.::
    她被葬在家族墓室里。))
verb
[I usually + adv/prep, T]
（用手支撑或撑杆）跳跃，跃过[英]^(to jump over something by first putting your hands on it or by using a pole)
  • ((He vaulted over the gate.::
    他从那扇大门上翻了过去。))
  • ((She vaulted the wall and kept running.::
    她跃过了那堵墙继续往前跑。))
  • ((He has vaulted 6.02 m in indoor competitions this year.::
    在今年的室内比赛中他跃过了6.02米的高度。))
[T]
突然提升;使跃居[英]^(to move someone or something suddenly to a much more important position)
  • ((Last week's changes vaulted the general to the top, over the heads of several of his seniors.::
    上周的变动使这位将军一下子超过他的几位上司而跃居最高层。))

vector

/ˈvek.tər//ˈvek.tɚ/
noun [C]
PHYSICS • MATHEMATICS
矢量;向量[英]^(a quantity or force that has size and direction)
BIOLOGY
（在动物或植物之间传播疾病的）昆虫媒介，传病媒介[英]^(an insect or animal that carries a disease from one animal or plant to another)
  • ((Mosquitoes are the vectors of malaria.::
    蚊子是疟疾的传播媒介。))

vector quantity

adjective [before noun]
PHYSICS • MATHEMATICS
矢量数量;向量数量[英]^(a quantity that has direction as well as size)
  • Momentum is a vector quantity but inertia is not.
  • This is compared to a vector quantity such as speed or position.
  • Vector quantities include velocity and direction.
  • Vector quantities can sometimes be difficult to calculate.
  • He used arrowed lines to represent each vector quantity.

vent

/vent//vent/
noun [C]
通风口；排气口[英]^(a small opening that allows air, smoke, or gas to enter or leave a closed space)
  • ((If you have a gas fire in a room, you should have some kind of outside vent.::
    如果你的屋里有煤气炉，那你就应该有个通向外面的排气口。))
（衣物的）开衩，衩口[英]^(a cut in the bottom of a piece of clothing to allow the person wearing it to move more easily)
  • ((The skirt is long and straight with two side vents.::
    这条裙子是很长的直筒裙，两侧开衩。))
verb [I or T]
C2
发泄，表达（负面的情绪）[英]^(to express a negative emotion in a forceful and often unfair way)
  • ((Please don't shout - there's no need to vent your frustration/anger/rage/spleen on me.::
    请不要大吵大闹——没有必要把气撒在我身上。))
  • ((I didn't mean to upset anyone, I just needed to vent.::
    我没想要针对任何人，我只是想发泄一下。))

give vent to something

/vent//vent/
noun
C2
（常指不公地）发泄（负面情绪）[英]^(to express a negative emotion in a forceful and often unfair way)
  • ((The meeting will be an opportunity for everyone to give vent to their feelings.::
    这次会议将给每个人一吐为快的机会。))

/ˈvaɪ.brənt//ˈvaɪ.brənt/

    他在画中经常运用鲜艳的色彩。))

vigil

/ˈvɪdʒ.əl//ˈvɪdʒ.əl/
noun [C or U]
（陪伴病人、祈祷、表达不同政见等的）不眠时间;（尤指）值夜，守夜[英]^(an act of staying awake, especially at night, in order to be with a person who is very ill or dying, or to make a protest, or to pray)
  • ((His parents kept vigil beside his bed for weeks before he died.::
    他去世之前，父母在他床边守夜守了好几个星期。))
  • ((Supporters of the peace movement held an all-night candlelit vigil outside the cathedral.::
    和平运动的支持者们在大教堂外举行了一次持续一整夜的烛光守夜祈祷活动。))

villa

/ˈvɪl.ə//ˈvɪl.ə/

  • ((They have a villa in Spain.::
    他们在西班牙有一栋别墅。))

villain

/ˈvɪl.ən//ˈvɪl.ən/
noun
[C]
流氓；恶棍[英]^(a bad person who harms other people or breaks the law)
  • ((Some people believe that Richard III was not the villain he is generally thought to have been.::
    有些人认为理查德三世不是通常人们认为的恶棍。))
  • ((He's either a hero or a villain, depending on your point of view.::
    他要么是英雄，要么是恶棍，这取决于你如何看了。))
[C] UK
罪犯[英]^(a criminal)
  • ((Bert's just a small-time villain.::
    伯特只是个小流氓。))
[C]
反面人物;反派角色[英]^(a character in a book, play, film, etc. who harms other people)
  • ((He made his reputation as an actor playing villains.::
    他靠演反派角色而出了名。))
[C usually singular]
首要危险；祸首[英]^(something or someone considered harmful or dangerous)
  • ((We've always been told that cholesterol was a major cause of heart disease but, actually, saturated fat is the worst villain.::
    我们一直被告知胆固醇是导致心脏病的主要原因，可实际上饱和脂肪才是罪魁祸首。))

vine

/vaɪn//vaɪn/
noun [C]
C1
(also grapevine)
葡萄藤[英]^(the climbing plant that produces grapes as its fruit)
藤本植物;攀缘植物[英]^(any type of plant that climbs or grows along the ground and has twisting stems)
  • ((Ivy is a type of vine.::

vintage

/ˈvɪn.tɪdʒ//ˈvɪn.t̬ɪdʒ/
adjective
（尤指过去某个时期）最佳的，最典型的，经典的[英]^(of high quality and lasting value, or showing the best and most typical characteristics of a particular type of thing)
  • ((This film is vintage Disney.::
    这是一部经典的迪斯尼影片。))
  • It has not been a vintage year for the club (= it has not been very successful).
  • His performance was not vintage, but it was capable enough.
[before noun]
（酒）佳酿的，上等的，标明酿制年份的[英]^(Vintage wine is of high quality and was made in a particular year and can be kept for several years in order to improve it.)
  • ((vintage champagne/port/claret::
    上等香槟／波尔图葡萄酒／干红葡萄酒))
noun
[C]
特定年份酿造的酒;酿造年份[英]^(the wine made in a particular year, or a particular year in which wine has been made)
  • ((The 1983 vintage was one of the best.::
    1983年酿制的酒是最好的酒之一。))
  • ((What vintage is this wine? (= In what year was it made?)::
    这酒是哪年酿制的？))
[U]
同时代生产的东西;同时代的一批人[英]^(a group of things that were produced, or a group of people who were active, during the same particular period)
  • ((Cars of recent vintage may not need inspection.::
    近期生产的批次的汽车可能不需要检查。))
  • You and I are of the same vintage, so we remember this.

vomit

/ˈvɒm.ɪt//ˈvɑː.mɪt/

C2

  • ((He came home drunk and vomited all over the kitchen floor.::
    他醉醺醺地回到家里，在厨房里吐了一地。))
  • ((She was vomiting (up) blood.::
    她在吐血。))

[C]

  • ((The voucher is valid between July and December and entitles you to ten percent off all overseas flights.::
    该代金券在7月至12月间有效，凭此券所有国际航班可享受9折的优惠。))
[C], [usually plural]
(also education voucher, school voucher)

  • ((Suburban voters are completely against vouchers.::
    郊区选民完全反对私立学校奖学金。))

  • ((The guerrillas vowed (that) they would overthrow the government.::
    游击队发誓要推翻政府。))
  • ((After the awful meals we had last Christmas, I vowed to do more of the cooking myself.::

    她发誓再也不借钱给别人了。))

wade

/weɪd//weɪd/
verb
[I usually + adv/prep, T] UK
（在水中）艰难地行进，涉水，蹚[英]^(to walk through water or other liquid with some effort, because it is deep enough to come quite high up your legs, or thick)
  • ((The river was full but we managed to wade across.::
    河里涨满了水，但我们设法蹚了过去。))
  • ((We waded a shallow river.::
    我们蹚过了一条浅浅的小河。))
  • ((They had to wade through a swamp.::
    他们不得不艰难地步行穿过沼泽地。))
[I] US
(UK paddle)
在浅水中蹚水（玩耍）[英]^(to walk in water that is not very deep)
  • ((We rolled up our trousers and waded at the edge of the lake.::
    我们卷起裤脚沿着湖边蹚水而行。))

wail

/weɪl//weɪl/
verb
[I or T]
恸哭；号啕大哭[英]^(to make a long, high cry, usually because of pain or sadness)
  • ((The women gathered around the coffin and began to wail, as was the custom in the region.::
    女人们都围到了棺材旁，开始号啕大哭，当地的风俗就是这样。))
  • (("My finger hurts," wailed the child.::
    “我的手指头很疼，”那个孩子大哭道。))
[I]
高声抱怨;大发牢骚[英]^(to complain loudly or strongly)
  • ((Business people wailed that their trade would be ruined.::
    生意人都强烈抱怨说他们的买卖会被毁掉的。))
noun [C]
恸哭;号啕大哭[英]^(a long, high, loud cry, especially because of something unpleasant)
  • ((a wail of anguish::
    痛苦的哀号))
  • ((the wail of the police sirens::
    警笛的尖啸声))

waive

/weɪv//weɪv/
verb [T]
放弃（权利）;不遵守（规则）[英]^(to not demand something you have a right to, or not cause a rule to be obeyed)
  • ((The bank manager waived the charge (= said we didn't have to pay), as we were old and valued customers.::
    那位银行经理没有收取我们的费用，因为我们是尊贵的老顾客。))
  • ((If they waive (= remove) the time limit, many more applications will come in.::
    假如取消时间限制，那么就会收到多得多的申请。))
  • ((He persuaded the delegates to waive (= give up) their objections.::
    他说服代表们不再反对。))

  • ((By the late 70s the band's popularity was beginning to wane.::
    上世纪70年代末，这支乐队的人气开始下滑。))

warp

/wɔːp//wɔːrp/
verb
[I or T]
（使）（木材）弯曲，（使）翘曲，（使）变形[英]^(If wood warps, or if water or heat warps it, it becomes damaged by bending or twisting.)
  • ((After being left in the damp garage, the wooden frame had warped.::
    由于放在潮湿的车库里，木头框架已经变形了。))
  • ((The heat had warped the boards.::
    热气已经让板子变形了。))
[T]
使（人或人的行为）反常，使变得乖戾；扭曲[英]^(to make a person or their behaviour strange, in an unpleasant or harmful way)
  • ((Prison warps people. Had it warped Kelley enough that he would kill a stranger?::
    监狱扭曲人性。它有没有使凯利变态到会杀死一个陌生人呢？))

the warp

/wɔːp//wɔːrp/
noun [S]

wasp

noun [C]
B2
黄蜂，胡蜂[英]^(a flying insect, often black and yellow, that can sting (= produce a small, painful skin injury))
  • ((There's a wasps' nest in that old tree.::
    那棵老树上有一个黄蜂巢。))
  • ((a wasp sting::
    被黄蜂蜇的一下))

WASP

/wɒsp//wɑːsp/
noun [C]
(also Wasp)
US
祖先为盎格鲁－撒克逊新教徒的白种人（White Anglo-Saxon Protestant的缩写）[英]^(abbreviation for White Anglo-Saxon Protestant: a white American whose family originally came from northern Europe, and is therefore part of a group often considered as having the most influence and the most money in American society)
  • ((My mother comes from an old WASP family which has been in this country for 350 years.::
    我母亲出身于一个具有盎格鲁－撒克逊裔白人血统的家族，该家族扎根于这个国家已有350多年了。))

waver

/ˈweɪ.vər//ˈweɪ.vɚ/
verb [I]
（尤指暂时地）动摇[英]^(to lose strength, determination, or purpose, especially temporarily)
  • ((I'm afraid my concentration began to waver as lunch approached.::
    恐怕我的注意力在临近午饭时要开始下降了。))
  • ((He has never wavered in his support for the leader.::
    他对领袖的支持从未动摇过。))
（在两个选择之间）踌躇，犹豫不决[英]^(If you waver between two possibilities, you cannot decide which of them to choose or you keep choosing one way and then the other.)
  • (("What are you going to have?" "Er, I'm wavering between the soup and the mushroom quiche."::
    “你要吃什么？”“哦，我正在犹豫是喝汤还是吃乳蛋饼。”))

web

/web//web/
noun [C]
B1
（蜘蛛）网[英]^(a net used to catch insects, made by a spider from the sticky thread that its body produces)
  • ((We watched a spider spin a web between three tall grass stems.::
    我们注视着一只蜘蛛在三根高高的草茎之间织了一张网。))
  • ((Those involved in the fraud created an intricate web of trading companies to hide their activities.::
    那些参与诈骗的人建立起一个交易公司的复杂网络，试图掩盖他们的活动。))
（某些水禽或水生动物的）蹼[英]^(the skin connecting the toes of some birds and other animals living by or on water that helps them when swimming)

the Web

/web//web/
noun [S]
A2
万维网[英]^(the system of connected documents on the internet)
  • ((Jane's been surfing the Web all morning.::
    简整个上午都在上网。))

wee

/wiː//wiː/
adjective [before noun]
Scottish English
小的；很小的[英]^(small; little)
  • ((You were just a wee lad the last time I saw you.::
    我上次见到你的时候，你还是一个小男孩。))
  • ((Would you care for a wee bit more to eat?::
    你想再吃一点吗？))
verb [I]
UK
排尿，小便[英]^(to urinate)
  • ((Daddy, I need to wee!::
    爸爸，我想撒尿！))
noun
[C] UK
排尿，小便[英]^(an act of urinating)
  • (("I really need a wee!" she said.::
    “我要撒尿！”她说道。))
[U] UK
尿[英]^(urine)

weld

/weld//weld/
verb [T]
焊接，锻接（金属）[英]^(to join two pieces of metal together permanently by melting the parts that touch)
  • ((Iron spikes have been welded (on) to the railings around the embassy.::
    大使馆周围的护栏上都焊上了铁刺尖头。))
使紧密结合；使形成整体[英]^(to make separate people into a group who can work together successfully)
  • ((He is a born leader, who welded a collection of gifted individualists into a real team.::
    他是个天生的领袖，把一群有才华的个人组成了一支真正的团队。))
noun [C]
焊接处;锻接点[英]^(a joint made by welding)

well

/wel//wel/
adverb
better | best
A1
很好地，令人满意地[英]^(in a good way, to a high or satisfactory standard)
  • ((The documentary presented both sides of the problem very well.::
    这部纪录片很好地展示了问题的两个方面。))
  • ((The concert was advertised well enough but ticket sales were poor.::
    这场音乐会的宣传搞得很不错，但是票房却不好。))
  • ((a well-cut suit::
    剪裁合身的西服))
  • ((a well-paid job::
    薪酬优厚的工作))
  • ((Her points were well put (= expressed in a good or intelligent way).::
    她的观点表达得很巧妙。))
  • ((His point about the need to reduce waste was well taken (= it was accepted as a good criticism).::
    他关于有必要减少浪费的观点得到了认同。))
  • ((They took two hours to discuss the plans and considered it time well spent (= it had been a useful discussion).::
    他们花了两个小时讨论这些计划，并且认为时间花得很值。))
  • ((I can't do it as well as Marie can.::
    我无法做得像玛丽那样好。))
A2
非常;充分地;完全地[英]^(very much, to a great degree, or completely)
  • ((Knead the dough well, then divide it into four pieces.::
    充分揉捏面团，然后将它分成4块。))
  • ((He could well imagine how much his promise was going to cost him.::
    他完全能想象出他要为自己的诺言付出多大的代价。))
  • ((I can't catch the bus - there are no buses after midnight, as you well know.::
    我没法坐公共汽车——午夜过后就没有公共汽车了，你很清楚这一点。))
  • ((He plays the piano well enough (= to a satisfactory standard).::
    他钢琴弹得非常好。))
C1
（用于强调某些介词）[英]^(used to emphasize some prepositions)
  • ((The results are well above/below what we expected.::
    结果比我们预想的要好／差得多。))
  • ((Keep well away from the edge of the cliff.::
    离悬崖边远远的。))
  • ((It cost well over £100.::
    它的价格远远高于100英镑。))
  • ((Stand well clear of the doors!::
    离门远点！))
B2
（用于强调某些形容词）[英]^(used to emphasize some adjectives)
  • ((The police are well aware of the situation.::
    警方非常清楚形势。))
  • ((The museum is well worth a visit.::
    那家博物馆很值得参观。))
  • ((Some machines look more like cheap, plastic toys - leave these well alone.::
    有些机器看着更像那种廉价的塑料玩具——千万别去碰它们。))
UK
非常[英]^(very)
  • ((The film was well good.::
    那部电影非常不错。))
  • ((Watch out for those two - they're well hard (= strong and willing to use violence).::
    小心那两个人——他们都不好惹。))
B2
有理由地；理由充分地[英]^(with good reason)
  • ((She might well be the best person to ask.::
    问她可能最合适。))
  • ((I can't very well (= it would not be acceptable to) refuse their generous offer.::
    我没有理由拒绝他们慷慨的提议。))
adjective [usually after verb]
better | best
A1
健康的[英]^(healthy; not ill)
  • ((He hasn't been very well lately.::
    他最近身体不太好。))
  • ((When she came home from school she really didn't look well.::
    她从学校回到家里时气色看起来真不好。))
  • ((I'm sorry you're ill - I hope you get well soon.::
    你生病了我很难过——希望你尽快好起来。))
  • ((They sent a get well card.::
    他们寄了一张祝愿早日康复的慰问卡。))
exclamation
A1
（用于引出要说的话题，常用来表示惊讶、怀疑、不太同意或生气，也用来继续讲故事）啊，哎呀，哟，那么，好吧[英]^(used to introduce something you are going to say, often to show surprise, doubt, slight disagreement, or anger, or to continue a story)
  • ((Well, what shall we do now?::
    那么，我们现在该做什么？))
  • ((Well now/then, how are we going to arrange things?::
    那么，现在我们该怎样安排呢？))
  • (("Who was that?" "Well, I can't remember her name."::
    “那人是谁呀啊？”“嗯，我记不起她的名字了。”))
  • (("He's decided to give up his job and move to Seattle with her." "Well, well - that's what love does for you."::
    “他已经决定放弃自己的工作同她一起搬到西雅图去了。”“嗯，嗯——这就是爱情的力量。”))
  • ((Well, really, that was thoughtless of him!::
    唉，说真的，他真是太轻率了！))
  • ((Well? What did you do next?::
    嗯？你接下来做了什么？))
  • ((Well, after that we went camping in the mountains.::
    唔，那之后我们就去山里露营了。))
  • ((Well/Oh well, it doesn't matter - I can always buy another one.::
    哦，没关系——我可以再买一个。))
  • ((Very well, if you insist I'll meet him next week.::
    好吧，如果你坚持，那我下周就见他一面。))
noun [C]
水井;油井;气井[英]^(a deep hole in the ground from which you can get water, oil, or gas)
verb [I usually + adv/prep]
（液体）涌出，溢出[英]^((of liquid) to appear on the surface of something or come slowly out from somewhere)
  • ((Dirty water welled (up) out of the damaged pipe.::
    污水从损坏的管道中冒了出来。))
  • ((As she read the letter tears welled up in her eyes.::
    她读信的时候眼泪夺眶而出。))
  • ((Conflicting emotions welled up in his heart.::
    他心里感到很矛盾。))

as well (as)

/wel//wel/
adverb
better | best
A1
除…之外还；也；和[英]^(in addition (to))
  • ((Invite Emily - and Scott as well.::
    邀请埃米莉——还有斯科特。))
  • ((I want to visit Andrew as well as Martin.::
    我想去拜访安德鲁，还有马丁。))

whine

/waɪn//waɪn/
verb [I]
发出哀鸣;发出哀叫声[英]^(to make a long, high, sad sound)
  • ((Leon's dog was sitting by the door whining, so I thought I'd better take it for a walk.::
    利昂的狗蹲在门口呜呜直叫，所以我觉得最好带它去遛遛。))
（尤指小孩）不停地嘀咕，哼哼唧唧[英]^(If you whine, especially as a child, you complain or express disappointment or unhappiness repeatedly.)
  • ((Alice, if you keep whining I won't take you - do you understand?::
    艾丽斯，如果你继续那样哼哼唧唧我就不带你了——明白了吧？))
noun [C usually singular]
刺耳的尖声[英]^(an unpleasant high sound or voice)
  • ((the whine of a circular saw::
    圆锯刺耳的尖声))
  • ((She delivered the speech in a high-pitched nasal whine.::
    她演讲时声音尖锐刺耳，鼻音很重。))

whisk

/wɪsk//wɪsk/
verb
[T usually + adv/prep]
突然拿走，快速带走[英]^(to take something or someone somewhere else suddenly and quickly)
  • ((Our coffees were whisked away before we'd even finished them.::
    我们的咖啡还没有喝完就被匆匆拿走了。))
  • ((We only had half an hour to see her before she was whisked off to some exotic location.::
    在她被匆匆送往国外某地之前，我们只有半个小时时间和她会面。))
  • ((Her husband whisked her off to Egypt for her birthday.::
    她丈夫突然把她带到了埃及，为她庆祝生日。))
[T]
搅打（鸡蛋、奶油等）[英]^(to beat eggs, cream, etc. with a special tool in order to add air and make the food light)
  • ((Whisk the egg whites until stiff.::
    搅打蛋清，直到变稠为止。))
  • ((Remove mixture from heat and whisk in the brandy and vanilla essence.::
    把混和好的原料从火上拿开，搅入白兰地和香草精。))
noun [C]
（厨房中的）搅拌器[英]^(a kitchen tool that you use for beating food such as eggs and cream in order to add air and make it light)
  • ((Using a whisk, blend the ingredients thoroughly.::
    手持式搅拌器))

wholesale

adjective, adverb
/ˈhəʊl.seɪl//ˈhoʊl.seɪl/
批发的（地）；成批卖的（地）[英]^(of or for the selling of goods in large amounts at low prices to shops and businesses, rather than the selling of goods in shops to customers)
  • ((wholesale prices::
    批发价))
  • ((a wholesale supplier/business::
    批发供应商／业务))
  • ((We only sell wholesale, not to the public.::
    我们只批发，不零售。))
（尤指坏事或过于极端的事）完全的（地），大规模的（地）[英]^((especially of something bad or too extreme) complete or affecting a lot of things, people, places, etc.)
  • ((wholesale changes::
    全面变革))
  • ((wholesale destruction::
    彻底毁灭))
noun [U]
/ˈhəʊl.seɪl//ˈhoʊl.seɪl/
(UK trade price)
US
批发价[英]^(the price at which goods are sold to shops by the people who produce them, rather than the price which the customer usually pays in the shop)
  • ((I bought my coat direct from the factory at wholesale.::
    我的大衣是按批发价直接从厂家购买的。))

wince

/wɪns//wɪns/
verb [I]
（因疼痛而）脸部肌肉抽搐，皱眉蹙额[英]^(to show pain or embarrassment suddenly and for a short time in the face, often moving the head back at the same time)
  • ((Did I hurt you? I thought I saw you wince.::
    我弄疼你了吗？——好像看到你皱了一下眉。))
  • ((It makes me wince even thinking about eye operations.::
    一想到眼部手术，我就不由得眉头一皱。))

winding

/ˈwaɪn.dɪŋ//ˈwaɪn.dɪŋ/

  • ((There's a very long, winding path leading up to the house.::
    有一条非常长的蜿蜒小路通向房子。))
  • ((They struggled up the narrow winding stairs.::
    他们费力地爬上狭窄蜿蜒的楼梯。))

wither

/ˈwɪð.ər//ˈwɪð.ɚ/
verb
(also wither away)
[I or T]
（使）枯萎，（使）干枯[英]^((to cause) to become weak and dry and decay)
  • ((Grass had withered in the fields.::
    田里的草都枯萎了。))
[I]
萎缩;逐渐消失[英]^(to slowly disappear, lose importance, or become weaker)
  • ((This country is in danger of allowing its industrial base to wither away.::
    这个国家正面临着工业基础萎缩的危险。))

wizard

/ˈwɪz.əd//ˈwɪz.ɚd/
noun [C]
男巫，术士[英]^(a man who is believed to have magical powers and who uses them to harm or help other people)
(UK also whizz); (US also whiz, wiz)
（某方面的）行家，奇才，高手[英]^(someone who is an expert at something or who has great ability in a particular subject)
  • ((a computer wizard::
    计算机高手))
  • ((Your mother's a wizard at Scrabble.::
    你妈妈是一个拼字游戏的能手。))

wobble

/ˈwɒb.əl//ˈwɑː.bəl/
verb
[I or T]
（使）摇晃，（使）摇摆[英]^(to (cause something to) shake or move from side to side in a way that shows poor balance)
  • ((That bookcase wobbles whenever you put anything on it.::
    那个书架你一放东西就摇摇晃晃的。))
  • ((Don't wobble the table, please, Dan.::
    丹，别晃桌子好吗？))
  • ((The company's shares wobbled with the news of a foreign takeover bid.::
    这家公司的股票由于外国公司收购的消息而波动。))
[I]
拿不定主意；动摇；（在两种观点间）变来变去[英]^(to be uncertain what to do or to change repeatedly between two opinions)
  • ((The government can't afford to wobble on this issue.::
    如果政府在这个问题上不作出果断决策就会付出巨大代价。))
noun [C]
摇晃，摇摆[英]^(a movement from side to side that shows poor balance)
  • ((I gave the poles a slight wobble and the whole tent collapsed.::
    我轻轻晃了晃几根柱子，整个帐篷就倒了。))
  • ((The closure of the company's German subsidiary caused a sharp wobble in its profits.::
    这家公司德国分部的关闭导致其利润急剧下降。))
UK
拿不定主意；动摇；（在两种观点间）变来变去[英]^(a feeling of not being certain about something)
  • ((She's having a bit of a wobble about the move to New York.::
    她对是否搬到纽约还有点犹豫不定。))

woes

/wəʊ//woʊ/
noun [plural]
困难；灾难；不幸[英]^(big problems or troubles)
  • ((The country has been beset by economic woes for the past decade.::
    过去十年来这个国家一直受到经济困难的困扰。))
  • ((Unusually poor harvests have added to the country's woes.::
    罕见的歉收加剧了该国的灾难。))

woe

/wəʊ//woʊ/
noun [U]
悲伤;悲哀[英]^(extreme sadness)
  • ((Her face was lined and full of woe.::
    她满脸皱纹，一副悲伤的表情。))
  • ((He told me a real tale of woe about how he had lost both his job and his house in the same week.::
    他给我讲了自己真实的不幸遭遇，是关于他如何在一周内既失去工作又失去房子的。))

woo

/wuː//wuː/
verb [T]
present participle wooing | past tense and past participle wooed
争取;努力说服[英]^(to try to persuade someone to support you or to use your business)
  • ((The party has been trying to woo the voters with promises of electoral reform.::
    该政党承诺进行选举改革以争取选民的支持。))
  • ((The airline has been offering discounted tickets to woo passengers away from their competitors.::
    这家航空公司一直在出售打折机票以从竞争对手那里争取乘客。))
（男子）向…求爱，向…求婚[英]^(If a man woos a woman, he gives her a lot of attention in an attempt to persuade her to marry him.)
  • ((He wooed her for months with flowers and expensive presents.::
    他用鲜花和昂贵的礼物追求了她好几个月。))

wretch

/retʃ//retʃ/
noun [C]
可怜的人；不幸的人[英]^(a person who experiences something unpleasant)
  • ((a poor/miserable wretch::
    可怜的／悲惨的人))
讨厌的人；无耻之徒；恶棍[英]^(someone who is unpleasant or annoying)
  • ((Who trampled on my flowers? I bet it was those two little wretches who live next door.::
    谁踩了我的花？我敢肯定是住在隔壁的那两个小坏蛋。))
  • ((You wretch! You promised you'd give me a lift.::
    你真讨厌！你答应过让我搭车的。))

wry

/raɪ//raɪ/
adjective [before noun]
讽刺的;解嘲的[英]^(showing that you find a bad or difficult situation slightly funny)
  • ((a wry smile/comment::
    苦笑／解嘲般的评论))

B2

  • ((a luxury yacht::
    豪华游艇))
  • ((a yacht club::
    帆船俱乐部))

yank

/jæŋk//jæŋk/
verb
[T usually + adv/prep]
猛拉;猛拽[英]^(to pull something forcefully with a quick movement)
  • ((He tripped over the cord and yanked the plug out.::
    他绊到了电线，一下子把插头拽了出来。))
  • ((She yanked open the cupboard door and everything fell out.::
    她猛地打开橱柜，所有东西都掉了出来。))
[T often passive] US
突然除掉[英]^(to suddenly remove someone or something)
  • ((I was yanked out of school and forced to go to work.::
    我被赶出了学校，只好去找工作。))

Yank

(also Yankee)

  • ((The place was full of Yanks.::
    这地方全是美国佬。))

yard

/jɑːd//jɑːrd/
noun [C]
B1
(written abbreviation yd)
码（相当于3英尺，约91.4厘米）[英]^(a unit of measurement equal to three feet or approximately 91.4 centimetres)
（进行某种工作的）场地，场所;（常指出售货物的）场地[英]^(an area of land in which a particular type of work is done, often one from which goods are sold)
  • ((a lumber yard::
    堆木场))
  • ((a scrap yard::
    废料场))
院子;天井;庭院[英]^(an area of land next to a building that usually has a hard surface and that is used for a special purpose)
  • ((The house has a small yard at the back.::
    这所房子后面有个小院。))
  • ((The children played in the school yard.::
    孩子们在学校的院落里玩耍。))
  • ((a prison yard::
    监狱里的院子))
A2 US
(UK garden)
（房屋旁的）园圃，花园[英]^(a piece of land next to a house, usually used for growing flowers, grass, and other plants)
  • ((The kids were playing in the yard.::
    孩子们在房子旁边的花园里玩。))

yarn

/jɑːn//jɑːrn/
noun
[C or U]
纱；纱线[英]^(thread used for making cloth or for knitting)
[C]
故事;奇闻漫谈[英]^(a story, usually a long one with a lot of excitement or interest)
  • ((He knew how to spin a good yarn (= tell a good story).::
    他知道如何编造有趣的故事。))

yearn

/jɜːn//jɝːn/
verb [I]
C2
渴望，切盼，渴求[英]^(to wish very strongly, especially for something that you cannot have or something that is very difficult to have)
  • ((Despite his great commercial success he still yearns for critical approval.::
    尽管他获得了巨大的票房成功，但还是渴望得到评论家的认可。))
  • ((Sometimes I just yearn to be alone.::
    有时我只想一人独处。))

yeast

/jiːst//jiːst/
noun [C or U]
酵母;酵母菌[英]^(a type of fungus that is used in making alcoholic drinks such as beer and wine, and for making bread swell and become light)
  • ((dried/fresh yeast::
    干／新鲜酵母))
  • ((yeast extract::
    酵母精))

yen

/jen//jen/
noun
plural yen
[C]
(symbol ¥)
日元[英]^(the standard unit of money used in Japan)
  • ((She earns 400,000 yen a month as an English teacher in Tokyo.::
    她在东京做英语老师，每月薪水40万日元。))
[C usually singular]
渴望，热望[英]^(a strong feeling of wanting or wishing for something)
  • ((I have a yen for travelling.::
    我渴望出去旅行。))

the yen

/jen//jen/
noun [S]
plural yen
（相对于其他货币的）日元（价格）[英]^(the value of the yen, used in comparing the values of different types of money from around the world)
  • ((The yen fell/rose against (= was worth less/more compared to) the dollar today.::
    今天，日元对美元价格下跌/上升了。))
